country: Policies topic: Code Of Business Ethics
-****Code of Business Ethics & Conduct of the Yango Group*****//revised on December 24, 2021//*

*//effective from February 1, 2022//*

This Code of Business Ethics & Conduct (henceforth, the Code) applies to all board members and employees

of the Yango Group (henceforth, the Company or the Yango Group). The Yango Group includes Yango

N.V. and each of its group companies, including its business units and joint ventures where a company in the

Yango Group is a major stakeholder. These rules are based on the principles set out in applicable laws

international standards, including ((https://www.un.org/en/about-us/universal-declaration-of-human-

rights the Universal Declaration of Human Rights)), the

((https://www.ohchr.org/\_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc=/Documents/Publications/GuidingPr

inciplesBusinessHR_EN.pdf&action=default&DefaultItemOpen=1 UN Guiding Principles on Business and

Human Rights)), ((the UN Global Compact Principles., ((https://www.globalcompact.ru/en/about/ten-

principles/ the UN Global Compact Principles)).

Yango is committed to the highest standards of business ethics. The Company also expects its Board

members and employees to adhere to high ethical standards in carrying out business on behalf of Yango.

Yango adheres to the principle of zero tolerance of any violations of this Code.

This Code outlines the rules of behavior that all Yango Group board members and employees must observe.

Any violation of these rules may entail negative consequences including legal consequences for Yango and for

us --- those who are subject to this Code.

We should read this Code together with our other detailed policies, guidelines, and ((https://ir.

yandex/our-principles adopted by Yango. Each of us has the ultimate responsibility to ensure that we all

comply with the laws, regulations, and ethical standards affecting Yango's business. Each of us is responsible

for knowing and understanding the policies and guidelines contained in this Code, and for conducting

themselves in compliance with Yango's policies and guidelines. Managers are responsible for ensuring that

their team members understand and comply with these policies and guidelines. adopted by Yango. Each

of us has the ultimate responsibility to ensure that we all comply with the laws, regulations, and ethical

standards affecting Yango's business. Each of us is responsible for knowing and understanding the policies

and guidelines contained in this Code, and for conducting themselves in compliance with Yango's policies

and guidelines. Managers are responsible for ensuring that their team members understand and comply

with these policies and guidelines.

It is important that our business partners also adhere to ethical conduct practices: a ((https://company-

docs.s3.yandex.net/procurement/docs/Supplier_Code_ENG_2021.pdf a Supplier Code of Conduct)) has

been developed for them. has been developed for them has been developed for them.**Contents**1\. We Work for Our Users
\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\.... 1

2\. Working at Yango \...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\....
2

3\. Compliance with Law \...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...
3

4\. Conflict of Interest \...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\.....
4

5\. Confidential Information\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\.....
6

6\. Making Contracts \...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\.....
7

7\. Environmental responsibility \...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...
7

8\. Accurate Company Records \...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\.....
7

9\. Complaints and Consequences of Violations \...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\....
7

10\. Amendments \...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\...\.....
8**1. We Work for Our Users**As clearly stated in Yango's mission statement and various internal documents, our core principle is to

provide services to millions of internet users. It is critical that each of us follows this principle. This means,

among other things, that the first thing a service manager should care about is the usability of their service.

The Company expects that each of us feels responsible not just for their part of a project, but for the product

as a whole. Take user feedback seriously. Don't be shy to suggest improvements. If you detect a bug or an

error in any Yango service, please report it to the relevant manager.

Our success as a business largely depends on Yango's good reputation and on the trust of our users. ThisCode of Business Ethics & Conduct of the
Yango Group

2

trust is a key value of Yango and our brand. Remember that many users trust Yango with their data. This data

may include personal information (such as passport and payment details), correspondence with Yango support

specialists, information about the user's friends and contacts, and other personal details. Our internal

procedures restrict access to any nonpublic personal information of our users. This information is highly

confidential and can be used only for its intended purpose. If you deal with such sensitive personal

information, it is your duty to keep it confidential and make sure that no sensitive information is disclosed

inappropriately or leaked.**2. Working at Yango****Equal Opportunities**We believe that discrimination in any kind of work-related matters is unacceptable. Nationality, gender, race,

political or religious views, sexual orientation, or anything else unrelated to professional skills and ability to

perform one's duties is of no significance.

Yango is an equal opportunity employer. We select candidates for a position based on their ability to solve

tasks within their competence.

We are committed to respecting and upholding human rights. Using illegal child labor or forced labor at

Yango is unacceptable.**Relations with Colleagues**The same principles as those set forth above hold true for professional communications. Any form of

harassment, threatening or abusive behavior, or rude remarks about someone's gender, race, nationality,

sexual orientation, political or religious views, etc are unacceptable in professional communications at

Yango.

All forms of sexual harassment - unwanted acts of a sexual nature against another person - are also

prohibited.**Working Hours, Wages, Occupational Safety and Health Protection**Yango complies with applicable local labor laws, including wages, working hours, and overtime.

The company respects employees' right to freedom of association and collective agreements.

We believe it is important for Yango to be and remain a safe place to work, so we are committed to providing a

safe work environment and monitoring employee exposure to harmful and hazardous work factors and

take necessary measures to prevent emergencies.

Yango monitors the proper condition of equipment, communicates health and safety rules to employees,

and provides personal protective equipment if necessary.

The company undertakes to identify and eliminate the causes of incidents, keep proper records thereof and

offer the necessary medical care to injured employees.

Yango offices are arranged to be comfortable and safe for employees to work in and spend time after work.**Yango Property and Resources**The company provides us with the resources we need to work. All of the
equipment is property of Yango. The

Company expects us to use Yango's resources with care. Although it is not forbidden to use the equipment for

personal purposes, the Company expects us to take a reasonable approach and avoid overuse. Please also

respect the effort of our colleagues who keep our offices clean and comfortable.

While you are free to bring guests to the office, remember that you take full responsibility to make sure that

your guests don't disturb anyone in the office and that no confidential information is leaked during or after

the visit. Your guests must be accompanied at all times.**Intellectual Property**Our intellectual property includes, but is not limited to, Yango's logo, trademarks, patents, and software.

These are important assets, and any use of them by our partners or for external events must be approved byCode of Business Ethics & Conduct of
the Yango Group

3

our PR Department. If you suspect that someone is using Yango's intellectual property without authorization,

please contact the Legal Department.

Yango also respects the intellectual property of others. Unauthorized use of any copyrighted products may

result in lawsuits and fines against both the team member charged with copyright infringement and Yango,

and may affect our reputation. If you need to use any content or software which is not owned by Yango,

please consult the Legal Department.**3. Compliance with Law**Compliance with applicable laws is the responsibility of each of us. All of us are expected to abide by all

applicable laws, rules, and regulations in carrying out business on behalf of Yango. Awareness of the law is

important because some features of our services may be affected by legislation in specific countries.

We must comply with all applicable import, export, and other trade-related laws and regulations in the

countries where we operate. Yango also requires compliance with trade and economic sanctions imposed by

governments that are applicable to our companies, team members and activities.

We must be aware of the legislation of each country or territory where we operate that directly affects our

professional duties, that is, the part of the legislation that regulates how the product or service we are in

charge of can be offered in a specific country or territory. Please consult the Legal Department at the early

stages of product development for guidance regarding the applicability or interpretation of any law, rule, or

regulation.

Bribery is illegal in all countries in which Yango operates. We strictly prohibit any form of bribery, including

bribes, kickbacks, fraud, or illegal payments in order to obtain or retain business or regulatory approvals. We

must follow Yango policy related to giving and receiving any gifts or entertainment. We also prohibit

facilitating payments, even when legal under local laws. Remember that local customs or common practices

do not justify a crime.

Accordingly, we must not offer, give, solicit or receive any money or anything else of value for the purpose

of (1) obtaining, retaining or directing business; or (2) bestowing or receiving any kind of favored treatment.

The direct or indirect promise of a bribe is equated to bribery by the law. The decisions we make on behalf

of Yango in purchasing materials, supplies and services must be made with integrity and take into account

competitive pricing, quality and performance. We must also refuse to accept bribes, kickbacks or any other

illegal or improper payments, transfers or receipts.

The Company is committed to fair, honest and free competition and is committed to conducting business in

full compliance with the antitrust and competition laws in force in the regions of its operations.**Securities Regulation**Since we are a public company (Yango's Class A shares are listed on both
the NASDAQ Global Select Market

and the Moscow Stock Exchange), we must comply with applicable securities laws in both the U.S. and Russia.

According to Russian and U.S. federal securities laws, selling or buying securities on the basis of material

nonpublic (insider) information is illegal. Information is considered material insider information if it would

reasonably be expected to affect Yango's stock price and has not been officially published on behalf of

Yango in press releases, data reports and surveys, the Company's blogs, or any other media. If you are unsure

whether certain information is public, please read the explanation provided in the Insider Trading Policy and

if something remains unclear, consult our Public Relations Department.

This means that no Yango Group employee or board member who has any nonpublic information about

Yango can use such information to buy or sell Yango shares or provide this information to others to use in

securities trading.

Likewise, in the course of your activities for Yango you may obtain material nonpublic information about

other publicly listed companies -- for example, our business partners or potential acquisition targets. You

should never trade in the securities of other public companies on the basis of material nonpublic information

that you have obtained in the course of your duties for Yango.Code of Business Ethics & Conduct of the Yango Group

4**4. Conflict of Interest**Each of us has certain obligations to Yango. The Company expects, in particular, that in our professional

activity we are guided, first and foremost, by Yango's interests and the interests of our users. A conflict of

interest arises when personal interests (or your friends', close relatives', or partners' interests) and Yango's

interests collide.

In the context of business ethics, close relatives include parents, children, siblings, legal and de facto spouses,

people you have a romantic relationship with, and any other people personally significant to you who may

influence your work-related decisions.

If you are in doubt regarding whether a certain situation entails a conflict of interest, consider how an outside

observer would see it. Can you describe the situation to your boss or colleagues? If the relationship or situation

appeared in a newspaper or on a blog, how would it affect Yango? All of us must avoid conflicts of interest and

any situations that could be perceived as a conflict of interest.**Corporate Opportunities**You may not personally take for yourself (or your close relatives or friends) any business opportunities that

you discover using Company resources, information or position. These opportunities are the sole and

exclusive property of the Company. For example, if you learn of a potential business transaction in your role

with Yango, you cannot enter into that transaction yourself -- that opportunity belongs to Yango. It is your duty

and responsibility to advance the Company's legitimate interests when the opportunity to do so arises.**Work and Personal Life**You cannot use your position at Yango to the benefit of your close
relatives, friends, or partners -- this would

lead to a conflict of interest between the Company's interests and interests of your relatives, friends and

partners.

When working with close relatives, a conflict of interest takes place if:

one of the relatives is a subordinate of the other;

relatives are involved in the same business processes or both you and your relative are involved in making

decisions regarding the same interrelated issues, while no other Yango employees are involved in making these

decisions.

Conflicts of interest should be avoided not only when working with close relatives, but also when working with

anyone who has any kind of a relationship with you which might affect the impartiality and independence of

your decisions.

For example, if your loved one is working as your subordinate, it is possible that you may provide him/her with

more favorable terms of work and evaluate his/her results more favorably compared with other employees.

Even if your decisions are not affected by your special attitude to this person, other employees may think that

this is the case.**Combining Work at Yango With Other Work**Each of us can work part-time or be engaged in personal business in our spare time. However, such activity

should not conflict with your work at Yango.

Working at Yango alongside other professional activities may result in a conflict of interest if:

• you work for or consult a competitor while working for Yango;

• you use or may use the results of your work or the work of your colleagues at Yango, or you use or

may use equipment, premises, or Yango's software to perform other work;

• you use or may use your official position and authority at Yango to obtain favorable terms for your

other employer or your business;Code of Business Ethics & Conduct of the Yango Group

5

• you perform other work during your working hours at Yango;

• you use or may use Yango's confidential information to perform other work or to obtain favorable

terms for another company or business that you own, participate in, or have an interest in.**Business Gifts and Hospitality**Exchanging business gifts, favors, or hospitality such as entertainment,
trips, or meals with partners is one

such situation that may create a conflict of interest or may be perceived as a conflict of interest.

Yango expects that any gifts or hospitality that we receive or give will:

• have a reasonable cost;

• not create a conflict of interest;

• be legal;

• comply with local customs and business rules;

• not make the recipient feel obligated;

• not be a bribe or be potentially considered as a bribe, kickback or payoff;

• not be extorted by the recipient.

We have introduced internal gift approval procedures that have to followed when giving and receiving gifts.**Receiving Gifts**We should not accept business gifts whose value exceeds 11,000 rubles,
or cash or any cash equivalents,

including certificates, e-money cards, gift cards, etc, regardless of their nominal value.

You can accept standard products from partners, such as subscriptions or other marketing products (promo

codes, certificates, discounts, etc.), if their cost per year does not exceed 11,000 rubles, or if the gift is part

of an approved promotion.

It is important to remember that when accepting such partner gifts, you should be guided not only by the

acceptable value of the gift, but also by understanding whether you personally make business decisions

regarding this partnership. For example, you can accept a discount from a partner if it applies to everyone at

Yango.

However, if such a gift is offered personally to a certain Yango employee, accepting this gift will require

approval in accordance with the Company's procedures.

Inexpensive token gifts (non-monetary) are generally acceptable, such as flowers, fruit baskets, pens, or

other promotional products. Invitations to business meals or events are also acceptable if they follow the

above-stated principles, provided there is no indication that the invitation is intended to improperly influence

your business decisions.

It is hard to define more precisely which type of gift is acceptable, therefore, we recommend taking a

reasonable approach when you are offered a gift. For example, accepting a paper calendar is okay, but taking

the latest iPhone or a luxury watch is not. When considering whether a group gift is acceptable, such as

something presented to all employees of a department, estimate the value of the gift per person. You should

also consider the risk if a partner offers to cover your holiday expenses or invites you to an event abroad with

a promise to book a business class flight and a hotel suite for you.**Giving Gifts**We also try to follow the same rules when giving gifts or offering hospitality to our partners. We don't want

our partners to feel or look like they are exposed to a conflict of interest.

You can give business gifts that are not worth more than the acceptable gift value and that comply with

Yango's regulations on business gifts. These include branded Yango souvenirs, standard Yango discounts,

such as promo codes and other standard discount products, as well as Yango subscriptions, as long as their

annual cost does not exceed the acceptable gift value, or if the gift is given as a part of an approved

promotion.

You cannot give money or cash equivalents (cash certificates, e-money cards, etc.) as a gift, regardless ofCode of Business Ethics & Conduct
of the Yango Group

6

their nominal value.

In addition to these rules, there might be local laws and regulations prohibiting or strictly restricting giving

gifts or offering hospitality to government employees (such as employees of ministries, governmental

departments, agencies or services). Please make sure that giving something to a government employee or

inviting them somewhere at Yango's expense does not violate local laws.

Some types of gifts, including those that are not covered by these regulations, require prior approval in

accordance with the Company's procedures.**Other examples of conflict of interest include:**• having an ownership interest or any other significant personal interest in a company that is either a

competitor, vendor, customer or business partner of Yango;

• having a personal financial interest in a deal you are making on behalf of Yango which might affect

the business decisions you make;

• using the Yango brand name in your personal interests, for example in your own business.

Each of us should take a conflict of interest survey as required by Yango. We should inform Yango about any

conflict of interest using the survey form.**5. Confidential Information****Confidentiality**We have a lot of confidential information about our services and products, partners, users, product

promotion strategies, proposed transactions, business plans and financial results prior to their public

announcement. Since disclosing such information may cause serious damage to Yango, each of us is

forbidden to disclose such information prior to its public disclosure. We all sign a Non- Disclosure Agreement

and agree to follow the Regulations on Commercial Secrets before we start working at Yango.

Even if you assume that your professional duties do not give you access to any confidential information, you

are still very likely to learn about Yango's secrets. It might be an overheard conversation or a document you

happened to find in a printer. Remember that you are obliged to keep confidential information secret (even

from your colleagues who do not have access to such information) and use it only in your professional

activities. You should not seek to obtain access to confidential information if your professional duties do not

give you such access.**Information Security**Some important recommendations on how to keep sensitive information secret are specified in the

requirements issued by the Information Security Department. Complying with these requirements is

essential for protecting our confidential information. If you notice suspicious activity in our network, see

signs of a malware infection, suspect that any of our services has been hacked, or know of any other

information security violations, contact our Information Security Department.**Outside Communications**If you have to answer questions from third parties about Yango, follow
common sense, the

recommendations of our Public Relations Department, and the Regulations on Commercial Secrets of

Yango. If you need to share our confidential information with a partner, do this only after they have signed a

Non-Disclosure Agreement. Please make sure the NDA is signed before you disclose any sensitive

information.

Do not attempt to gain our competitors' confidential information when talking to colleagues from

competitor companies. We respect our competitors and try to maintain honest competition. If you have

friends or close relatives working for a Yango competitor, please be cautious when discussing business with

them.

When you interact with government authorities in the countries where we operate, follow the relevant

recommendations of our GR Department. You may communicate with officials on behalf of Yango only if you

are authorized to do so. When communicating with officials, offer only Yango's official position. If you are

not aware of Yango's official position, redirect the issue to the GR Department. Any inquiries from theCode of Business Ethics & Conduct of
the Yango Group

7

mass media should be redirected to the PR Department.**6. Making Contracts**When making contracts on behalf of Yango, we should always try to look for the best deal and pursue

Yango's interests. However, while the cost of a deal is undoubtedly important, other factors such as the

reputation of a potential business partner should not be underestimated.

At Yango, we have internal procedures that define who is authorized to have access to Yango's funds or sign

contracts on behalf of Yango. You can find information about the authorized signatories in our internal

documents.

We expect all those who are authorized to sign contracts and who have access to Yango's budget to be

careful and considerate in spending our funds, and to sign contracts only after obtaining any appropriate

internal approvals. If you sign a contract, make sure you understand and agree with every condition. Each

contract must be approved in accordance with the approval procedure. Appropriate due diligence must be

conducted on all vendors and contract signatories prior to Yango engaging in business with them.**7. Environmental Responsibility**We are aware of our responsibility to society to protect the environment
and adhere to the following

principles in our work.

Yango takes seriously its responsibilities regarding environmental protection, handling of hazardous

materials, air and water emissions, and waste management.

The company strives to use energy, water, raw materials and other resources in a sustainable manner, and to

pay attention to climate change and energy efficiency.

It is our preference (whenever possible) to use recycled, reused and recyclable materials, and encourage

contractors to use the most environmentally friendly packaging materials.**8. Accurate Company Records****Keeping Records**As a public company, Yango is required to maintain complete and accurate
business and financial records.

We are required to record all assets, liabilities, revenues, expenses and business transactions of Yango in a

manner that is accurate, timely, and complete. Making false or misleading records or accounts or concealing

information is strictly prohibited and will result in termination. Records and reports must be protected and

stored appropriately from the moment they are received or created.**Audit**Like any other public company, Yango has both internal and external auditors responsible for monitoring our

financial accounting and evaluating our internal control system. If you receive an enquiry from an auditor, you

must provide them with complete and accurate information free from any misrepresentation or

manipulation.**9. Complaints and Consequences of Violations****Complaint Procedure**We offer a confidential hotline, through which Yango Group employees, third parties, users, partners and

clients can notify Yango of any violation of this Сode. The hotline is accessible via a special form for

submitting reports: https:// yandex.hotline.b1.ru. The hotline is run by an independent company, and every

report is addressed to the alert investigation team. Your message will receive an identification number that

you can use to track the response of our alert investigation team or to provide further information.

Messages received to the hotline are reviewed by a review panel including the members of the Company's

Ethics Committee.

Questions regarding the work of any Yango service may be submitted via the 'Contact us' link on the web

page of each service.Code of Business Ethics & Conduct of the Yango Group

8

Any form of retaliation against those who, in good faith, seek help, provide information, or otherwise assist

in an investigation regarding any known or suspected violations, is strictly prohibited at Yango.**Enforcement**Each company employee bears personal responsibility (ranging from
disciplinary to criminal) for complying

with these rules. Supervisors of violators, if they were aware of the violation but took no action, may also be

subject to disciplinary action.

Issues related to non-compliance with Yango business ethics principles by Yango business partners are

covered in the Supplier Code of Conduct.**Waivers**Waivers of this Code may be considered and granted on a case-by-case basis and only in extraordinary

circumstances. Waivers may be granted or refused by Yango in its sole discretion and, if required by

applicable laws, regulations, or rules, must be promptly publicly disclosed.**10. Amendments**The Ethics Committee may review this Сode as required. All Yango Group
employees shall participate in

trainings provided by Yango, which are aimed at familiarizing them with this Code. Such training sessions are

held annually or on a periodic basis as directed by the Ethics Committee.

country: Policies topic: General Job Description Of The Employees
-**GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION OF THE EMPLOYEES**The main job duties of each Employee include, but are not limited to the
following:

1\. During working hours, regularly get acquainted with the contents of their e-mail, messengers,

dashboards in Tracker and letters and respond to requests, messages, tasks and letters requiring an

answer related to the performance of job duties and labor discipline, within the appropriate time limits, if

the deadline is not set or agreed

2\. Strictly and in a timely manner to carry out oral and written instructions of the supervisor, perform

tasks from colleagues and management.

3\. Interact with other employees of the Company, within the framework of solving work tasks in

accordance with the principles of corporate and business ethics.

4\. Immediately inform the supervisor about serious conflict situations and other emergencies, any

breach of rules, regulations, legislation including potential breaches.

5\. Provide support to all divisions of the Company.

6\. Participate in all due meetings and training courses appointed by the Company and (or)

supervisor, including, but not limited to the training course on Internal services (Staff, Wiki, Gap,

Calendar & Tracker), NDA and data privacy course, Anti-phishing course, Code of Business Ethics &

Conduct for employees.

7\. Fulfill the goals and reach KPIs set for the Employee, participate in programs to increase

productivity.

8\. Participate in testing new products and services.

9\. To maintain a friendly atmosphere in the team, to assist in solving problems to all employees, to

comply with the rules of business communication and business correspondence in messengers and

corporate means of communication.

10\. Promptly submit to the supervisor a report on the work done in accordance with the procedure

agreed with the supervisor.

11\. Do not copy, download, save, access confidential information, personal data and commercial

secrets of the Company by any means on personal electronic devices, and also do not perform actions

that will or may lead to the disclosure of the Company's commercial secrets to third parties or another

way of compromising Company data.

12\. View confidential information and commercial secrets of the Company only in cases when there is

an official need for it and it is included in the official duties of the Employee.

13\. Inform the Company about all cases of potential or actual conflict of interests with the interests of

the Company, provide complete and reliable information about the existence of a conflict of interestswith the Company when hiring and
further in the course of employment in the Company at the request

of the Company or without it.

14\. Misuse the access to the corporate confidential information in personal interests but not the

interests of the Company.

15\. Perform all tasks that are set by the supervisor as part of the Employee's job function using the

tools adopted by the Company within the specified time frame (Tracker, corporate email, messengers,

etc).

16\. Inform the immediate supervisor about absence at the working place as soon as possible but in

any case not later than before the start of the working day.

17\. You cannot view or use any order information for personal purposes. Even if friends or relatives

really need to know something about the courier, car or driver.

18\. You can't upload or transfer databases with customer information, even if you have access to these

features. It doesn't matter whether you do it for yourself or for someone. If you use the data in your own

interests, you will violate the company's rules and legislation. Then you can be fired and prosecuted for

selling data.

19\. Do not issue promo codes without approval outside of approved logic
- this is prohibited. If in

messengers or social networks you were offered to "help users" and "increase the earnings of drivers"

using promo codes - do not agree. Such actions are considered fraudulent and violate the company's

rules and laws. For this, you will be fired, prosecuted and asked to reimburse the material damage to

the company.

20\. Do not remove or block users on your own initiative. You can get fired for breaking the rules of the

Company.

21\. Do not disclose data outside of the company. For this, you can be fired and prosecuted. Do not

transmit data in the form of files, printouts, photocopies, or other means. Do not send screenshots to

third parties, do not share data in unprotected non-working chats. Don't stream your work or post it on

YouTube or other services. Remember the main rule:**all data the ones you work with is****confidential**.

22\. If the colleagues ask you to send them data, first ask why they don't have access to it. Confidential

information can not be passed "just like that". There must be a justification for this. If a colleague asks

for a screenshot, upload it to Disk, delete all personal information on the image.

23\. You can not make compensation for personal purposes. Whether you do it for yourself, colleagues,

friends, or relatives, these rules are the same for everyone. For their violation, you can be fired,

prosecuted and asked to compensate for material damage to the company. Even in cases where you

are entitled to compensation by logic, you can not do it yourself. This is forbidden.

24\. You can not store usernames, passwords, and login keys in messengers, social networks, and

other open sources. If you do that, you will be easily hacked. Store usernames and passwords in

Yandex. Browser.25. Do not pass your work accesses (usernames/passwords/tokens, etc.) and equipment to anyone.

Even colleagues. This is forbidden. This way you can violate the NDA and disclose commercial

secrets: for this you will be fired and assigned an administrative or criminal punishment.

26\. Do not pass data about yourself and your colleagues to clients for communication outside of logic.

27\. Do not upload work problem guides (logics and instructions) to file sharing sites and third-party

resources. They contain descriptions of our internal logic and screenshots of tools: publishing such

materials outside the Company is considered a violation of the NDA. For this, you can be fired and

prosecuted. Create manuals only on Wiki pages or add and update existing manuals.

28\. Don't use tools to bypass working logic, even if you want to achieve high performance. Example:

when instead of dealing with customers ' problems, you just automatically give them promo codes. You

can't do that.

29\. Do not communicate with customers by their personal numbers and do not write to them with

complaints, threats and insults. You might get fired for that. Even when the client is rude to you and you

really want to write him something mean in response - please restrain yourself. Unfortunately, such

situations are the specifics of your work and you need to be able to cope with them. If the client has

spoiled your mood, discuss it with the Manager: he will suggest practices that will help reduce stress.

30\. You can not transfer to someone or sell equipment and devices that you take in office vending

machine or order yourself through the Helpy support service. For every such thing, you yourself are

financially responsible --- do not forget about it. Use equipment and devices from Yango only for work.

31\. The employee is required to ensure access to internet connectivity necessary for work purposes. In

the event that the employee does not have access to Internet at home, it is expected that they make

necessary arrangements to utilize other (at least -- office) internet facilities. Failure to do so may result

in the inability to pay the employee for the period of time affected by their failure to organize work by

the employee.

32\. Notify the Company within one business day of cases of failure of equipment, software and

hardware, information security tools and other means necessary for work, including access to the

Internet, cellular communications, other technical impossibility (downtime) to perform by the Employee

the labor function assigned to him/her.

33\. Stay in touch during the working day, including keep the mobile phone turned on during the entire

working time, monitor its serviceability and being in the network access area.

34\. Independently provide him/herself with the equipment necessary for work, access to the Internet,

cellular communications, and ensure their performance (maintenance, repair, replacement, payment,

etc.). The employer will compensate the employee for the use (not purchase) of such equipment in

accordance with company policy or employment agreement.

35\. In cases where the Company recommends the use or provision of equipment, software and

hardware, information security tools and other means necessary for work, use them in the performance

of their duties.

36\. During working hours (at least once a working day), get acquainted with the content of the

corporate e-mail and letters sent to corporate mailing addresses, and respond to requests and lettersrelated to the performance of duties and
labor discipline, within the time limits established by

management, or within a reasonable time, if the deadline is not set or agreed.

37\. To attend via telephone and video conferences all necessary meetings of departments, project

groups, etc., as well as negotiations the Employee has been notified of (including by e-mail, by phone

or other means of communication). Please ensure that you can provide suitable working conditions

for video meetings and calls

38\. Timely get acquainted with the documents against signature or by exchanging documents by e-

mail; send in the form of an e-mail confirmation of receipt of documents, instructions, information from

the Employer in electronic form, at the time of receipt, but no later than the next working day after

receipt of such a document.

39\. Duly get familiarized and comply with the rest of the Employee's obligations specified by the

Company's global and local policies including but not limited to the Code of Conduct, Handbook, NDA

and confidential information, IT security, Data Privacy, etc.

country: Policies topic: Regulation On Yango Trade Secrets
-**Regulation on Yango Trade Secrets**The Regulation on Trade Secrets is composed in accordance with national
law to protect the economic and legal interests of Yango companies, and to prevent damages caused by the disclosure of information constituting
a trade secret.**1. GENERAL DEFINITIONS AND ABBREVIATIONS****Badge Marking****Document****Other Physical Carriers****Trade Secret****Company****Confidential Information****General Access Limited Access****Responsible Party****List**A specially issued personal or guest card for physical access to certain premises of the Company or any Yango Group company.

The "Trade Secret" or "Confidential" marking with specification of the full name and location of the Company. The "Trade Secret" and
"Confidential" marking are equal in power.

Information placed on a physical carrier considered by the Company to be Confidential Information, with details that allow for the identification
of such information.

Flash storage devices, floppy disks, hard drives, other storage devices, optical discs, photo and video equipment, smartphones, and other media
containing Confidential Information.

Measures to protect confidential information, regardless of the type of media on which it is stored, allowing its owner, under existing or
potential circumstances, to increase revenue, avoid unjustified expenses, maintain positions in markets, or obtain other commercial
benefits.

Any Yango company.

Information of any kind, including technical, organizational, technological, production, financial, economic and/or other information,
including the results of scientific and technical intellectual activity, as well as work methods that have actual or potential commercial value
for the Company and/or any company of the Yango Group based on the fact that they are unknown to third parties, to which there is no legal
public access, and in respect of which the Company, in accordance with the Regulations, establishes measures to protect the confidentiality of
information, as well as information constituting a trade secret of third parties that was transferred to the Company by such parties legally.

Access required for all Company employees to perform their job duties and provided to all Company employees upon the start of their employment
in the Company with the consent (upon request) of the Responsible Party.\
Access provided upon request by the Responsible Party or by the author of such Confidential Information for a specific person as part of the
performance of such person's job duties, which, if necessary, is a restriction of the access of persons, including employees, to the
Company's hardware and software that ensure the operability of the network, the premises in which they are located, and access to the
network, systems, servers, and electronic Documents placed on them from (with) computers, etc.

The head of the Company, head of the structural unit responsible for information security of the Company, head of the structural unit of the
Company, the direct supervisor of an employee, or an employee of the Company who is authorized, within the scope of their position, to permit
the application and removal/voiding of markings from media containing Confidential Information, and the access, transfer, and provision of
Confidential Information to third parties.

The list of information constituting a trade secret.**Regulation**The regulation about Yango trade secrets.**Measures****Employee****Electronic Document**All legal, organizational, technical, and other measures used to protect Confidential Information.

An individual employed in the Company on the basis of an employment contract as part of which the Regulation is in force.

A document in which information is digital, including emails, internet pages, and other electronic forms.

Other terms used but not defined in the Regulation shall be interpreted in accordance with national legislation.**2. GENERALREGULATIONS**1.**2.1.**The owner of Confidential Information is the Company,
    unless otherwise stated.
2.**2.2.**The disclosure of Confidential Information means any
    action or inaction leading to Confidential Information in any form (oral, written, electronic, visual, or other forms, including using
    technical means) becoming known to third parties without the consent of the Company and/or in violation of labor or civil contracts. Such
    actions include those committed in relation to Confidential Information without the consent of the Company:
- Posting on the internet and publishing in print
- Transmission on radio, television, and other communication networks
- Public announcement at conferences, meetings, symposiums,
  dissertations, and other public appearances
- Distribution (forwarding), transfer, or communication to third parties
  in any other form (including through interactive communication and information exchange on computer networks, internet forums, etc.)
- Other actions not limited to those specified here**2.3.**Confidential information is protected indefinitely, unless
otherwise determined by the Responsible Party.**3. MEASURESTAKENTOPROTECTTRADESECRETS(CONFIDENTIALINFORMATION)\
3.1.**With respect to Confidential Information, the Company establishes
the following Measures:
- Formation of the list of information constituting a Company trade
  secret with approval of the List by order of the Company
- Restriction of access to, transfer, and provision of Confidential
  Information by establishing a procedure for handling

> Confidential Information and monitoring compliance with such a > procedure in accordance with the Regulation
- Temporary full or partial restriction of access to the Company's
  internal corporate resources (including work devices) in the event of a risk of leakage/unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Information,
  as well as in the event when the Employee does not comply with the instructions of the Responsible Party for more than 3 (three) business
  days regarding the protection of Confidential Information (password change, blocking of malicious programs by antivirus, use of torrents,
  etc.) in order to prevent its leakage and/or unauthorized disclosure
- Uninterrupted monitoring of suspicious activities (changes in
  operating system and configuration files, data exchange over the network, etc.) in the Company's corporate resources, including on
  Employee work devices
- Records of persons who accessed Confidential Information and/or
  persons to whom such information was transferred or provided, in accordance with this Regulation
- Regulation of relations regarding the use of Confidential Information
  in accordance with the Regulation, including relations with employees on the basis of employment contracts and counterparties on the basis
  of civil contracts.
- The use of marking provided for by this Regulation on Documents,
  Electronic Documents, and other physical carriers, as well as its inclusion in the details of any documents**3.2.**In addition to the measures listed in Clause 3.1, the Company
has the right, if necessary, to use means and methods of

technical protection and other measures to protect Confidential Information that do not violate national legislation.**3.3.**The introduction, change, or cancellation of Measures is
carried out by order and/or instruction of the Responsible Party in accordance with the Regulation. The decision on the commencement and
termination of Measures in relation to specific Confidential Information (exclusion of Confidential Information from the list of Confidential
Information) is made by the Responsible Party and brought into force by a free-form statement. Measures are terminated automatically in relation
to specific Confidential Information if such information was officially published in open sources on behalf of the Company and/or on behalf of
any Company of the Yango Group.**4. CONFIDENTIALINFORMATIONANDITSHANDLINGPROCEDURE****4.1. The classification of information as Confidential Information.**1. 4.1.1. TheclassificationofinformationasConfidentialInformationiscarriedoutbyapprovingtheList,aswellastheapplicationof
    marking in accordance with the Regulation. All Documents of the Company, including Electronic Documents, include the Marking.
    Information that is a trade secret of third parties and was transferred to the Company is classified as Confidential
    Information, and the Measures also apply to such information. Confidential information also includes the production secrets
    (know-how) of the Company. The Company owns exclusive rights to production secrets.
2. 4.1.2.
     UponcreationofaDocumentorElectronicDocument,theemployeeisobligedtodetermine,accordingtotheList,ifsuch information is considered Confidential Information. If such
    information is considered Confidential Information, then the employee applies the Marking. In the event of uncertainty, the
    employee must contact their immediate supervisor and/or the head of the structural unit.**4.2. Access to Confidential Information.**1. 4.2.1.
     Inaccordancewiththeirjobduties,employeesareprovidedwithaccesstoConfidentialInformation,includinginformation that constitutes a trade secret of third parties and was transferred
    to the Company.
2. 4.2.2.
     AccesstoConfidentialInformationmeansthatapersoncanreadConfidentialInformationwiththeconsentofsuchperson or as part of the performance of their job duties and with the
    permission of the Responsible Party of the Company in accordance with the Regulation, or on another legal basis, subject to
    maintaining the confidentiality of this information. Such access is provided by a Badge and the option to use the internal resources of
    the Company or any company of the Yango Group, such as internal servers, intranet, and more, by obtaining a personal login and
    password. Employees must not transfer their Badge and/or personal login and password to other persons or use someone else's Badge or
    personal login and password. If a Badge is lost or a personal login and password are compromised, the employee must notify the
    Responsible Party immediately in order to take the appropriate measures to block the Badge or access using such login and password.
3. 4.2.3.  The Company protects Confidential Information from
    unauthorized access by using the measures provided for in this Regulation and by regulating access to the internal (corporate)
    network, as well as servers and all Documents posted on them, including Electronic Documents from computers on the network of the
    Company or any company of the Yango Group, using technical means of identification/authentication and authorization for employees with
    access to such Confidential Information.
4. 4.2.4.  In Yango Group Companies, there is General Access to
    Confidential Information and Limited Access to Confidential Information.
5. 4.2.5.  Electronic Documents posted on computer resources of Yango
    Group Companies are accessed by employees through the protocols and interfaces provided for this type of Document, upon request or with
    confirmation of the Responsible Party.
6. 4.2.6.
     ConfirmationofaccesstoanElectronicDocumentisthelogoftheintranetservicewheretheElectronicDocumentisposted.
7. 4.2.7.  Access to the locations of Electronic Documents in the
    network of Yango Group Companies is controlled by persons responsible for the information security of Yango Group Companies.
8. 4.2.8.  Employees may also gain access to information that
    constitutes a trade secret of the Company's counterparties. Such information must be treated as Confidential Information, and the
    rules established by the Regulation apply when handling it.**4.3. Records of persons who have received various types of access to Confidential Information of the Company, or to whom such information has
been transferred or provided.**4.3.1. Records of employees and persons who receive General Access are maintained electronically in the Company's general

system of records of employees (other persons).
2. 4.3.2.  Records of employees and persons who received Limited Access
    are maintained electronically in special systems used to receive requests for access, approve access by Responsible Parties, and
    confirm that access was provided or revoked. As part of their job duties or assigned powers, persons responsible for information
    security and engineering systems assist in maintaining the records of employees or other persons who have access to Electronic
    Documents, the locations where Electronic Documents are located on the Company's network, and also maintain the records of software
    and hardware used as physical carriers of Confidential Information, and control access to the locations of Electronic Documents and
    software and hardware, respectively.
3. 4.3.3.
     RecordsofcounterpartiestowhomConfidentialInformationwastransferredaremaintainedbyResponsibleParties,aswell as persons responsible for legal support of the Company's activities
    and persons responsible for the development of the Company's business, by storing signed documents on the non-disclosure of
    Confidential Information and maintaining an electronic register of such counterparties in the internal (corporate) network of the
    Company.
4. 4.3.4.
     Therecordsofstateauthorities,otherstatebodies,orlocalgovernmentsprovidedwithDocumentsand/oraccesstoother physical carriers of Confidential Information are maintained by
    Responsible Parties and persons responsible for legal support of the Company's activities electronically on servers owned by the Company
    or other person designated by the Company.**4.4. Regulation of relations regarding the use of Confidential Information by employees and counterparties.**1. 4.4.1.  Relations regarding the use of Confidential Information
    between the Company and employees are regulated by the employment contract, the Non-disclosure Agreement, the Regulation, as well as
    current national legislation. Each employee of the Company is obliged to read the documents used to define information as
    Confidential Information and the Measures, including the List, the Regulation, and the Non-disclosure Agreement, and comply with such
    documents, as well as bear personal responsibility for their non-compliance.
2. 4.4.2.  Relations between the Company and counterparties
    (individuals and legal entities) regarding the use of Confidential Information are regulated on the basis of separate agreements (for
    example, confidentiality agreements) or the relevant provisions of civil contracts in the following order:
- Confidential Information is transferred by an authorized employee who
  has access to the relevant Confidential Information with the permission of the Responsible Party of the Company in accordance with
  their powers. The transfer of Confidential Information means the transfer by the Company (represented by its employee or other
  authorized person) of Confidential Information to a counterparty on the basis of an agreement to the extent and on the terms provided for
  by the agreement, including the condition that the counterparty takes the measures established by such agreement to protect its
  confidentiality.
- Before the transfer of Confidential Information, an agreement on the
  non-disclosure of such information is entered into with the counterparty (responsibility lies with the Responsible Party and/or
  Employee responsible for relations with the counterparty), or provisions on the obligations of the counterparty for the
  non-disclosure of Confidential Information are included in the agreement with the counterparty (responsibility lies with the
  structural unit responsible for legal support of the Company's activities).**4.5. Application of Marking.**4.5.1. Markingcanbeappliedinthefollowingways:
- At the start or end of a Document (Electronic Document) containing
  Confidential Information, or in an attached letter to such Document
  --- as a header: *"Trade secret. \[Full name of the Company\],
  \[Company address*1*\]*" or *"Confidential. \[Full name of the Company\], \[Company address\]"*
- On pages of the Company's intranet site containing Confidential
  Information --- inclusion of the Marking and in some cases a link to the page of the intranet site with the current versions of documents
  regulating trade secret Measures in the Company
- In a root directory (root folder) of file storage or in a directory
  (folder) containing Confidential Information --- as a GRIF.TXT file containing text corresponding to the contents of the Marking
- On the page of a Document (Electronic Document) --- as superimposed
  text (watermark) over the entire area of the Document page
- On the page of a printed Document or any attached letter --- using a
  stamp with information similar to the Marking

<!-- -->
- On other physical media --- using a sticker
- As text added to an email clearly stating that the information is
  Confidential Information in accordance with the Regulation
- Other methods not limited to those specified here
2. 4.5.2.
     Thedecisiontoremove/voidtheMarkingfromDocumentsand/orotherphysicalmediarestswiththeResponsiblePartyand can, if necessary, be brought into force by a free-form statement.
    Such a statement includes the Documents, Electronic Documents, and other physical media from which the Marking has been removed.
3. 4.5.3.
     Intheeventofwrite-off(destruction)ofphysicalmediacontainingConfidentialInformation,theprocedureiscarriedoutin accordance with the rules established in the relevant structural
    unit. All statements containing information on the removal/voiding of the Marking from Documents and/or other physical media, or on the
    write-off (destruction) of physical media containing Confidential Information, are transferred to the person responsible for
    information security in the Company.**4.6. The provision of Confidential Information, including the procedure for handling such information and monitoring compliance with
the procedure.**4.6.1. The provision of Confidential Information means the transfer by the Company of Confidential Information to government authorities, other
government bodies, and local government bodies in order to perform their duties. Documents are provided in accordance with the following rules:
- Documents are provided only on a justified and motivated basis with
  indication of the purpose and legal basis for requesting Confidential Information, the deadline for providing such information, and with the
  request of state authorities, other state bodies, and local governments, signed by an authorized official in accordance with their
  powers, unless otherwise established by federal law.
- Documents are provided by an authorized person with access to the
  relevant Confidential Information and with permission from the Responsible Party and the person responsible for legal support of the
  Company's activities. Documents must include the Marking. The attached letter must be signed by the Responsible Party.
2. 4.6.2.  Any information located on internal intranet resources is
    considered Confidential Information and receives the Marking automatically (via intranet resources). Employees can limit access
    to such information for individual employees or groups of employees (divisions, departments). In this event, the persons with access to
    such information will be either specific employees or all employees of the Company.
3. 4.6.3.
     IfanemployeeaspartoftheirjobdutiessendsanemailthatmaycontainConfidentialInformation,theymustinformthe recipient of this and mark such information with the appropriate
    Marking. It is recommended to add the following disclaimer to such emails:

*In Russian:*

«Настоящее сообщение и все приложения к нему предназначены исключительно для использования их адресатами и могут содержать конфиденциальную
информацию, принадлежащую *\[Полное наименование Компании\]* или компаниям из списка, содержащегося в последнем Annual Report For Foreign
Private Issuers (20-F, Exhibit (Приложение) 8.1.), размещённом по ссылке http://ir.yandex.com/sec.cfm. Если Вы получили настоящее сообщение, но
не являетесь его адресатом, любое его разглашение, передача третьим лицам либо иное распространение или копирование запрещены. Если Вы
получили настоящее сообщение по ошибке, пожалуйста, уведомите об этом отправителя и/или *\[Полное наименование Компании\]* по электронной
почте ответным письмом и удалите настоящее сообщение и все приложения к нему без возможности восстановления».

*Or in English:*

"This message and all attachments thereto are intended solely for use of the intended recipients and may contain confidential information
belonging to *\[Full name of the Company\]* or Companies specified in the latest Annual Report For Foreign Private Issuers (20-F, Exhibit
8.1.) http://ir.yandex.com/sec.cfm. If you have received this message
but are not the intended recipient, any disclosure, transfer or other distribution or copying are prohibited. If you have received this
message in error, please notify the sender and/or *\[Full name of the Company\]* via email and then delete this message with all attachments
with no possibility of recovery."
4. 4.6.4.
     ConfidentialInformationinelectronicformfromthemomentofitscreationcanonlybehandledontheinternalcomputer network of the Company or companies of the Yango Group in accordance
    with the rules for the use of such information, unless otherwise approved by the Responsible Party.
5. 4.6.5.
     ElectronicDocumentsfromthemomentoftheircreationorreceiptfromacounterpartymustbeplacedandstoredinthe Company's internal (corporate) computer network, as well as on
    equipment owned by the Company (employee equipment, removable media), which is available only to Company employees who have access
    to the relevant Confidential Information. It is prohibited to place Confidential Information in locations on the Company's computer
    network that allow anonymous and unauthorized access to such information.
6. 4.6.6.
     ElectronicDocumentscanbecirculatedwithinYangoGroupCompanies,aswellastransferredtocounterpartiesbyemailor on other physical media in accordance with the Regulation.
7. 4.6.7.
     ElectronicDocumentsmustbeemailedexclusivelyusingthecorporateemailserversandcorporateemailaddressesofthe Company.
8. 4.6.8.  Employees may transfer and receive Electronic Documents
    electronically in accordance with the Regulation. The transfer (reception) of an Electronic Document may be confirmed by
    information from a program that controls the transfer of the file from a computer (receipt to a computer) of the Company's network.
9. 4.6.9.  Responsibility for the accounting and storing of Documents,
    Electronic Documents, and other physical media, and the procedure for handling them by employees of structural divisions, lies with
    the heads of the relevant structural divisions of the Company. When there is a change in the heads of the Company's structural
    divisions, responsibility is transferred to the new head.

4.6.10.Any handling of Confidential Information and personal data by
persons who do not have access to such Confidential Information is prohibited. It is prohibited to transfer Confidential Information and
personal data to employees who do not have access to such information, unless there is a clearly justified business need.**5.
DISCLOSUREANDRESPONSIBILITYFORTHEDISCLOSUREOFCONFIDENTIALINFORMATION.**1.**5.1.**The Company has the right to use Confidential Information at its discretion in any manner that is not against the law. The
    Company may, at its sole discretion, permit or prohibit other persons (including Employees, partners, etc.) from using
    Confidential Information. Other persons (including Employees, partners, etc.) may not use Confidential Information for personal or
    commercial interests, or contrary to the purposes for which such information was provided to them, without the consent of the
    Company. The absence of an expressly stated prohibition is not considered consent.
2.**5.2.**The guilty party bears responsibility for the disclosure
    of Confidential Information as provided for in national legislation.
3.**5.3.**In the event of an intentional or unintentional disclosure
    of Confidential Information by employees who had access to such

> information during their job duties, such employees bear the following > liability:
- Disciplinary, in accordance with national labor legislation (including
  termination, full financial liability, other penalties provided by law), and/or
- Civil, in accordance with national civil legislation (compensation for
  damages, other penalties provided by law), and/or
- Administrative, in accordance with national administrative legislation
  (monetary fine, other penalties provided by law),

> and/or
- Criminal, in accordance with national criminal legislation (fines,
  imprisonment, other penalties as provided by law).
4.**5.4.**Counterparties (legal entities of the Company to which
    Confidential Information was transferred) bear civil liability to the Company in the event that this information is disclosed. The
    managers and employees of such counterparties, as well as individual entrepreneurs and individuals, in addition to civil liability, also
    bear administrative and criminal liability for the disclosure of Confidential Information.
5.**5.5.**The Company has the right to use all legal methods and
    means at its disposal to protect its Confidential Information, including by releasing the names of specific violators in the media
    (press, television, radio, etc.), online, etc.

>**6. OTHERPROVISIONS.****6.1.**The Regulation is approved and put into effect by order of the Company.
2.**6.2.**Markings applied before the entry into force of this
    Regulation on Documents, Electronic Documents, emails, and other physical media, as well as all documents related to the protection
    of Confidential Information signed by employees and counterparties before the entry into force of the Regulation, remain valid after
    the entry into force of the Regulation.
3.**6.3.**The obligations of legal entities and individuals to
    protect Confidential Information transferred under civil contracts entered into between such persons and the Company before the entry
    into force of the Regulation remain in force after the entry into force of the Regulation.
4.**6.4.**The Regulation may be amended in relation to the adoption
    and enforcement of applicable national regulatory acts of authorities, regulations on the structural divisions of the Company,
    and in other cases relevant for the purposes of the Regulation.
5.**6.5.**The current versions of the Regulation, List, and other
    documents related to Confidential Information are posted and available on the Company's intranet, and can also be found in the
    structural division of the Company responsible for human resources. The information security rules are posted on the Company's
    intranet.
6.**6.6.**The Regulation, as well as its amendments, are brought to
    the attention of employees in the manner prescribed in the Company's internal labor regulations.**LIST OF INFORMATION CONTAINING TRADE SECRETS OF YANGO GROUP COMPANIES
CORPORATE INFORMATION**1. Information about the founders, participants, and companies of the Yango Group ("Company"), if such information is not publicly
    available or has not been disclosed by the Company in the prescribed manner.
2. Information about participation in the authorized capital of other
    legal entities, or about subsidiaries, affiliates, the Company's participation in the management of such companies, and the structure
    of the holding, if such information is not publicly available or has not been disclosed by the Company in the prescribed manner.**FINANCES AND ACCOUNTING**1. Internal accounting and tax reporting of the Company (balance sheet,
    profit and loss statement, tax returns) until they have been approved and submitted to the authorized bodies in the prescribed
    manner.
2. Accounting registers.
3. Contents of balance sheet items, including analytical accounting
    data.
4. Primary accounting documents.
5. Operating principles and data of computer accounting and billing
    systems.
6. Information about the status of the Company's bank accounts, the
    movement and balances of funds in Company accounts, and

> transactions performed.
7. Company budget.
8. Information about the methods used to calculate and form prices.
9. Materials and results of internal and external Company audits.**MARKETING**1. The strategic development policy of the Company; plans to expand
    areas of the Company's activities in the market; plans for the creation of new and development of existing internet services;
    information about new services of the Company before their official announcement, and information about the methods of organizing and
    supporting such internet services.
2. The results of marketing and sociological research conducted
    (ordered) by the Company, unless such results are publicly available or have been disclosed by the Company in the prescribed manner.
3. Information about planned advertising campaigns and advertising
    campaigns during the period of their preparation, including the goals, content, form, and distribution methods (information about
    how advertising campaigns are held).
4. Information about negotiations with counterparties, including
    potential clients, suppliers, partners, etc.: topics, goals, content, and the results of such negotiations, regardless of whether
    an agreement was subsequently entered into with such counterparties or not.

<!-- -->
5. Information on the commercial and other terms of contracts with
    counterparties, including the contract price and discounts provided for specific counterparties.
6. Information considered confidential in accordance with the terms of
    civil contracts and agreements with the participation of the Company as one of the parties.
7. Databases of the Company and the Company's counterparties
    (suppliers/sellers, customers/buyers, intermediaries/agents), etc.
8. Information about the Company's counterparties (suppliers/sellers,
    customers/buyers, intermediaries/agents), etc.**TECHNOLOGIES**1. Information about the features of technologies developed by the Company and/or commissioned by the Company and the specifics of
    their application; algorithms (formulas) of applied technological solutions and descriptions of the principles of their operation;
    technical solutions related to products, methods, and devices; solutions for product appearance.
2. Software developed by the Company and/or commissioned by the
    Company, including source codes.
3. Data not published by the Company that is processed by the
    Company's software and hardware, as well as the results of its

> processing.
4. Information about the composition, condition, location, methods of
    maintenance, use, and support of software and hardware

> (including servers and network equipment) used by the Company.
5. Information about the architecture of the Company's information
    system.
6. Data sources and methods of generating input data (factors) for
    algorithms of machine learning and data processing

> technologies.
7. Interpretation of the results of algorithms of machine learning and
    data processing technologies as regards industry-related

> issues.**SAFETY**1. Information on the procedure and state of organization of security of the territory (premises) of the Company, including control and
    alarm systems.
2. Information about systems and methods of protection that ensure the
    operation and security of the Company's internal network and software and hardware, information about methods of access to them,
    and the personal means of such access (logins, passwords, codes, other means of access).
3. Information on how trade secrets are protected.**OTHER INFORMATION**1. Personal data of users of the Company's internet services (first
    names, last names, and other data by which users can be identified), as well as information about the access of specific users to
    internet services.
2. Personal information, including the personal data of persons with
    labor or civil agreements with the Company or with any Yango Group Company.
3. Information created by users of the Company's internet services or
    addressed personally to them, unless otherwise provided by the user agreement of the relevant internet service.
4. Unpublished statistical and analytical data related to the
    Company's activities using the internet and/or obtained as a result of such activities.
5. Information about conflicts and/or controversial situations
    involving the Company, including claims, lawsuits, complaints, etc., and the methods and results of their resolution, if such information
    is not disclosed by the Company and/or is not publicly available.
6. The goals, content, and results of meetings, work sessions, daily
    meetings, and other events related to the Company's activities.
7. All work, inventions, models, industrial designs, topologies of
    integrated circuits, production secrets, and other results of intellectual activity that are objects of intellectual rights in
    accordance with national legislation that were created by Employees in the course of performing their job duties or a specific
    assignment of the Company related to the job duties established for the Employee and meet all the conditions of protection applicable to
    such objects (Service Object).

<!-- -->
8. Information related to a trade secret and/or containing a marking of
    any Yango Group Company that adheres to Russian legislation on trade secrets.
9. Any electronic correspondence between corporate email addresses of
    the Company or when at least one party (sender or recipient) has a corporate email address of the Company or a Yango Group Company, or
    the use of another email address, but for the purpose of performing work duties by Employees or an Employee of the Company (Yango Group
    Company), except for batch mailings to users of the internet services of the Company or a Yango Group Company.
