## Business trips

### Requirements for a business trip ticket
- A business trip cannot last longer than 45 calendar days.
- A business trip is a temporary change of your place of work in the
  interests of the company. If you work remotely and change the place of work that is specified in the employment contract, returning to your
  official city of work will not be considered a business trip.
- If you want to stay in another country longer than your actual
  business trip, please issue a ticket [VACATION](https://st.yandex-team.ru/VACATION) and link it to
  the business trip ticket.

### How to get a daily allowance

The daily allowance will be paid to you only after the trip is completed, at the same time as the salary.

Within three days after the end of the trip, you need to attach receipts and other supporting documents to the ticket. It is important that all
documents are issued correctly, and the checks are preserved, otherwise travel expenses will not be compensated.

More information about business trips and daily allowance can be found on [Wiki](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/hr/travel-all/oformlenie-komandirovok-mezhdunarodnyx-ofisov/).

## Vacation
- In Georgia, they pay for 24 days of vacation a year, in addition to
  them, you can take 15 vacation days at your own expense.
- You can go on vacation 11 months after you start working for the
  company, but by agreement, you can go earlier.
- Only working days, from Monday to Friday, are taken into account in
  the holiday.

### How to get paid vacation
1. Arrange your vacation with the Manager in advance.
2. Specify the absence of [Staff](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/).
3. A ticket will be formed, approved by the Manager, and then HR will
    take over.
4. The HR Manager will send you an application form and sign it. This
    can be done both electronically and in the office.

### Holiday

Vacation pay together with the salary for the reporting month. They are calculated from the average salary for the last three months of work.
The calculation includes both the fixed payment, which is specified in the contract, and any bonuses and bonuses that you have received in the
last three months. If the average salary for the last three months is higher than the fixed salary, the difference will be visible in Payslip,
in the line "Addition for paid vacation".

### If you do not use the vacation in time

If you haven't used your entire vacation in the current year, the remainder will be transferred to the next year. You can't postpone your
vacation for two years in a row. This means that if you do not use your vacation for two years, the accumulated days for the first year will
burn and will not be compensated in any way. You can only compensate for vacation days when you are fired.

### Leave without pay

Leave without pay can be taken for 15 calendar days a year, but by agreement of the parties it is possible for a longer period.
1. 2 weeks before your vacation, coordinate it with your supervisor.
2. Specify the absence of [Staff](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/).
3. A ticket will be formed, approved by the Manager, and then HR will
    take over.
4. The HR Manager will send you an application form and sign it. This
    can be done both electronically and in the office.

The amount for vacation days will be deducted from the salary of the month in which you used the vacation.

## Maternity and child care leave

#### Maternity leave

##  You can request maternity leave for up to 126 calendar days. it is paid from the Georgian budget. If there were complications during childbirth or you have twins, the vacation can be increased to 143 days. You can distribute your own vacation for the pregnancy and postpartum period.

## parental leave

Child care leave is 604 calendar days. If there were complications during childbirth or you have twins-up to 587 calendar days. 57 days of
them are paid from the budget of Georgia.

Maternity and child care leave can only be used

sequentially, for 183 or 200 calendar days, respectively.

If you want to use child care leave, you must notify your employer 2 weeks in advance.

### Payment calculation

The total amount of payments from the Georgian budget for 183 days of both holidays cannot exceed 2000 lari. The company independently
increases this amount to your full salary in terms of 57 days of leave to care for a child.

### Who can take a vacation

Both the mother and the father of the child can use the child's parental leave in full or in part.\
Maternity leave is the exclusive right of the child's mother, but the father can take leave on days that the mother did not use.

### Additional parental leave

If you care for a child, you may be granted additional leave without pay at your request. In total, you have the right to take from 2 to 12 weeks
of vacation a year continuously or in parts, if your child is not yet 5 years old.

## Medical

Sick pay is 100% of the fixed salary specified in the employment contract. You can take a maximum of 40 calendar days of sick leave and
60 calendar days in the amount of six months.

### How to issue a sick leave
1. Report the illness to your supervisor.
2. Contact your doctor and issue a sick leave.
3. Put the absence on [Staff](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/) due to
    illness. The Manager can do it for you.
4. A ticket will be automatically generated, to which you or your
    Manager must send a scan of the sick list after it is closed.

### How to fill out a sick list
- The medical officer must correctly indicate the name of the employer
  in English or Georgian. For example, ridنتდტექ ჯორჯიن or ridetech Georgia LLC.
- Your position on the sick list must match the position in the
  employment contract.

### Payment for sick leave

Sick days will only be paid after you submit a closed sick list to the staff. This will be done in the final calculation for the reporting
month. Payment cannot be obtained based on Form \# 100, certificate or other document from the attending physician.

The sick leave must be issued by a medical institution in Georgia. If the employee's sick leave is not closed at the time of payment, the
amount for the missed time will be temporarily withheld from the salary.

If you open a sick leave during your vacation, let your Manager and HR Manager know. The days of leave that coincided with the period of
illness on the sick list will remain.

## Help

Standard certificates are prepared 3-5 business days from the date of application. It may take more than five days to prepare a non-standard
reference, for example, using your own template or with any text.

To get help, fill in [form](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/hr/spravka/). A ticket will be created automatically.

## Dismissal

### How the process works
1. 30 days before the planned date of dismissal, fill in and
    submit [form](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/ext/surveys/13692179/), a ticket will automatically be created.
2. The HR Manager will prepare an application and send it to you in the
    ticket.
3. The original application will need to be signed at the company's
    office. If you live in another city, you can send it by courier.
4. If you received corporate equipment, keys, or chips, hand them over
    to your supervisor on the last business day. If you are using an Apple laptop, make sure that you have untied your Apple ID.
5. No later than 7 days from the date of dismissal, you will be paid
    the final payment, if you have not agreed on other dates.

## Fitpass

Read more about how to issue a Fitpass sports subscription on [Wiki](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/users/ok-kh/fitpass-georgia/).

country: Georgia topic: Приветственное Письмо Грузия
- Привет!

Мы рады, что ты присоединился к нам и стал частью нашей команды. В нашей компании существует ряд определенных правил, которых мы придерживаемся,
и каждый сотрудник должен быть с ними знаком. Отправляю тебе перечень наших нормативных документов на английском и грузинском языках, выбери
тот язык, который тебе наиболее удобен.

https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/ridetech-international/hr-policies/hr-policies-ridetech-georgia-llc/

После начала работы в компании тебе полагается медицинское страхование. Страхование распространяется на сотрудника и стоимость полностью
покрывает компания.

Также по своему желанию ты можешь подключить к страхованию членов семьи (супруга/супругу и/или детей). Для того, чтобы подключить страхование
необходимо заполнить форму: https://forms.yandex-team.ru/ext/surveys/13675310/.

В случае, если ты хочешь подключить членов семьи, то стоимость индивидуального пакета покроет компания, а разницу между стоимостью
семейного и индивидуального пакета компания покроет на 80%, а остальные 20% будут ежемесячно удерживаться с заработной платы.

Форму можно заполнить прямо сейчас. Если ты не хочешь использовать страхование, напиши, пожалуйста, обратным письмом «отказываюсь от
медицинского страхования»

Более подробно о медицинском страховании можно узнать по ссылке: https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/international-benefits/georgia/insurance-in-georgia/?from=%2Fhr-department-bg-e-com-and-ridetech%2Finsurance-in-georgia-1

Также в нашей компании действует программа Fitpass.

Подробности: https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/users/ok-kh/fitpass-georgia/

Все сотрудники нашей компании по своему желанию могут присоединиться к зарплатному проекту в TBC банке. Участие в проекте позволяет нашим
сотрудникам иметь выгодные условия обслуживания и получать заработную плату без каких-либо банковских задержек. Более подробно с условиями
обслуживания ты можешь ознакомиться на брошюре во вложении. Если ты желаешь присоединиться к зарплатному проекту, напиши, пожалуйста, письмо
на countries@yandex-team.ru, с указанием места получения твоей карты в любом филиале TBC BANK (необходимо указать точный адрес).

Более подробно об HR сервисах можно узнать по ссылке: https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/cis-compendium/gruzija/

Если у тебя возникнут вопросы, не стесняйся обращаться ко мне, я буду рада помочь!

სალამი!

მოხარულნი ვართ, რომ შემოგვიერთდი და გახდი ჩვენი გუნდის წევრი. ჩვენს კომპანიაში არსებობს განსაზღვრული წესები, რომლებსაც ჩვენ ვიცავთ და
თითოეული თანამშრომელი უნდა იცნობდეს მათ. გიგზავნი ჩვენი მარეგულირებელი დოკუმენტების ჩამონათვალს ინგლისურ და ქართულ ენებზე, აირჩიე შენთვის უფრო
მოსახერხებელი ენა.

https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/ridetech-international/hr-policies/hr-policies-ridetech-georgia-llc/

კომპანიაში მუშაობის დაწყების შემდეგ შენ გეკუთვნის ჯანმრთელობის დაზღვევა. დაზღვევა ვრცელდება თანამშრომელზე და ხარჯს სრულად ფარავს კომპანია.

ასევე საკუთარი სურვილისამებრ შენ შეგიძლია შეცვალო დაზღვევის პაკეტი და ჩართო ოჯახის წევრები (მეუღლე ან/და შვილები).

თუ გსურს ოჯახის წევრების ჩართვა, ინდივიდუალური პაკეტის ღირებულებას დაფარავს კომპანია, ხოლო საოჯახო და ინდივიდუალური პაკეტის ღირებულებას
შორის სხვაობა დაფარავს კომპანიას 80%-ით, ხოლო დანარჩენ 20%-ს ყოველთვიურად ჩამოიჭრება ხელფასიდან.

დაზღვევის მისაღებად უნდა შეავსო ფორმა: https://forms.yandex-team.ru/ext/surveys/13675310/. რომელიც შეგიძლია
შეავსო ახლავე. თუ არ გსურს დაზღვევის გამოყენება, გთხოვ დაწერო საპასუხო წერილით „არ მსურს ჯანმრთელობის დაზღვევის გამოყენება".

დამატებითი ინფორმაცია ჯანმრთელობის დაზღვევის შესახებ შეგიძლია იხილო ბმულზე:
https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/international-benefits/georgia/insurance-in-georgia/?from=%2Fhr-department-bg-e-com-and-ridetech%2Finsurance-in-georgia-1

ჩვენ კომპანიაში ასევე ხელმისაწვდომია Fitpass-ის პროგრამა.

დეტალები: https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/users/ok-kh/fitpass-georgia/

country: Georgia topic: Ridetech Georgia Llc Employee Handbook
- Ridetech Georgia LLC EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK

1 Introduction This Employee Handbook is a summary of the employment policies and procedures of Ridetech Georgia LLC (referred to hereinafter
as the "Company"), applicable to all Company employees with regard to the following:

Workweek, Daily Schedule and Reporting Time Off: Vacation, Holidays, Illness, Others Travel Policy Anti-harassment Personal Information
Communications Please take time to read this Handbook carefully, taking into account that it is designed to assist you with the policies and
procedures of Company. This Handbook is the primary document that describes Company's policies and procedures with respect to the
subjects addressed herein. It is not intended to and does not form part of your contract of employment with Company. However, it is a condition
that all employees comply with the contents of this Handbook. Company expects to revise and update this Handbook from time to time. Company
will advise employees of changes (including additions or deletions) in policies and procedures covered in this Handbook by circulating such
changes in writing at least two weeks in advance. This Employee Handbook is not your only source of information on employment-related issues.
Although this Handbook will be the best place to begin looking for answers to employment-related questions, you may from time to time have
questions that the Handbook does not answer. In those situations, you should talk with your supervisor or someone in the HR Department. Any
reference that is masculine is intended for men and women alike. 2 WORKWEEK, DAILY SCHEDULE AND REPORTING Workweek and Scheduling
Company's normal business hours are from 10 am to 19 pm from Monday to Friday. The employee's working hours will be performed either on a full
time basis or part time basis depending on the employee's employment agreement. For employees working in the Company's office on a full time
basis, the normal work day for Monday to Friday is 8 hours plus 1 hour break for meals and rest each day. For remote employees, work schedules
are set indicating the length of the working day, breaks, days off. Also, for remote employees are set the summarized accounting of working
hours with an accounting period of one calendar year. For employees working on a part time basis, the normal work day will be as set forth
in their employment agreement. Any other types of work schedule (i.e., 6 days work week, shifts, cumulative working hours accounting, etc.) will
be directly stipulated by the employment agreements. Overtime Employees may be required, from time to time, to work beyond normal work hours and
on irregular work days. Employees are expected to work overtime hours are necessary to complete their work but not more than 2 hours per day
(longer than the standard working time), 4 hours of overtime per week. Employees receive a payment for overtime compensation. Each employee is
responsible for his compliance with the related work and rest legal provisions and may not work more than the maximum amount of permitted
overtime stated above. Company reserves the right to change the regular work week, the normal business hours, or the normal workday with prior
consent of the employees where required by law. Employees are expected to work all assigned hours and days. Requests for scheduling changes or
for particular days off must be made ahead of time and approved by Company. Attendance and Tardiness Employees are expected to report for
work when assigned, on a regular basis, and on time. Regular and timely attendance is an essential function of every employee's job and critical
to the smooth operation of Company. 3 If an employee is unable to report to work, or will be late, in addition to reporting this as set forth
below, the employee must contact his supervisor as soon as possible before the employee's scheduled starting time. If the supervisor is
unavailable, the employee should send an email message stating the reason for being late or absent, when the employee is anticipated to
return to work, and a telephone number where the employee may be reached. If the absence or tardiness is due to an emergency, the
employee must have someone contact Company as mentioned in this policy as soon as possible. Recurring absenteeism or tardiness may result in
disciplinary action. TIME OFF Annual Vacation The main goal is to give the employee an opportunity to take vacation during regular work days
while receiving his regular salary. The purpose is to let the employee rest from work, take vacation and renew his energy. This Policy sets
forth rules, rights and obligations with respect to taking of annual vacation and limits the accumulation of vacation days. The employee must
take his annual vacation at a time coordinated in advance with his supervisor, must report the planned annual leave in the on-line Staff
system immediately after it has been approved by the supervisor, and, at the time the annual leave is taken, must report it on the on-line
attendance system. The Number of Annual Vacation Days The employee is entitled to 24 work days as a vacation annually starting from the first
year of employment, but no less than the minimum amount of annual vacation days prescribed by law. If the employee works part-time, he
will be entitled pro-rated amount of vacation days. If the employee works part of the calendar year, this entitlement to vacation days will
be calculated in accordance with The Annual Vacation Law. The Time of the Annual Vacation The time of the annual vacation will be determined
by Company, in accordance with Company's needs and taking into consideration the employee's preferences. The employee can take a
vacation after having worked for 11 months. The employee can use it earlier by agreement with Company.An employee that wants to use his
annual vacation days must coordinate the dates of his vacation in advance with his supervisor and to receive the supervisor's approval of
the dates of the vacation by reporting the desired vacation dates through on-line Staff system no later than 10 days in advance. The
Company will be able to ask the employee to take vacation according to its needs by giving prior notice of at least 14 days for a vacation of
at least 7 consecutive calendar days, or prior notice of at least 2 days for a vacation that is shorter than 7 consecutive calendar days. 4 The
Time of the Unpaid Vacation An employee also has the right to enjoy unpaid vacation of at least 15 working days annually. When taking unpaid
leave, an employee shall notify the employer thereof 2 weeks prior to taking the leave, unless such notification is impossible due to urgent
medical necessity or family circumstances. Accumulation of Vacation Days Company encourages its employees to take all of their annual leave
during the corresponding year. The balance of annual vacation days that the employee is entitled to is set forth on the employee's monthly
pay-slip. The employee is responsible for reviewing the balance of outstanding annual vacation days and to take the annual vacation in a
timely manner. Negative Balance of Vacation Days Company will allow an employee to take not more than five (5) vacation days in excess of the
vacation days that he has accumulated (hereinafter: "Negative Balance Days"). Any additional vacation taken by the employee, subject to the
employee's supervisor's consent, will be treated as unpaid vacation and its value will be deducted from the employee's pay. Additional negative
annual vacation days (in excess of the 5 permitted Negative Balance Days), will be allowed only with the written approval of Director, to be
provided to the employee and to the payroll department. If the employee has taken Negative Balance Days they will be set off against the
entitlement of the employee to annual vacation days immediately when they accumulate as soon as possible. If at the time of the termination
of employment, initiated by either employee or Company, the employee has a negative balance of annual vacation days, Company will deduct the
value of the said negative balance from amount due to the employee by Company. If such deduction did not cover the entire value of the
negative balance, the employee will pay Company the value of the outstanding negative balance. Payment in Lieu of Unused Annual Vacation
Days Company will redeem the employee's outstanding annual vacation days upon termination of the employment and not during the course of the
employment. Family Related Time Off Company allows paid time off for family related reasons, such as the birth of a child, and other reasons,
as stated by law. Employee may also request material support which Company may approve and provide material support in the amount decided
by Company. Holidays An employee that receives compensation on a monthly basis is entitled to payment for these holidays starting from the
beginning of his employment with Company. 5 An employee that receives compensation on an hourly or daily basis is entitled to payment for
these holidays after three months of work with Company and as long as he was not absent from work without Company's permission on the day before
the holiday and the day after the holiday. Sickness Sick leave can be taken by an employee on the basis of the medical certificate issued by
the treating doctor. Duly authorized sick leave is compensated with 100% salary. Use of Sick Days to Take Care of a Sick Family Member An
employee may utilize accumulated sick days in order to take care of a sick family member, subject to presenting the relevant medical
certificate of the family member. This is considered ordinary sick leave subject to all conditions above. Prolonged Sickness After the use of all
the employee's accumulated sick-days, the employee may use his accumulated annual vacation days. After the employee has utilized all
his accumulated sick days and accumulated annual vacation days, the employee will be on unpaid leave without having to sign any documents.
Maternity / Paternity / Parental Time Off Employees are entitled to maternity/parental and other types of leave as prescribed by law and
this policy. As required by law Company provide employees with maternity leave of 126 (or 143, in case of complications during childbirth or the
birth of twins) calendar days. Parental leave of 604 (or 587, in case of complications during childbirth or the birth of twins) calendar days is
available to either parent. 57 calendar days out of these are paid by the state. If the payment from the state is less than the Employee's
monthly salary, Company will pay the difference so that the Employee receives the amount equal to Employee's monthly salary. The remaining of
the leave is unpaid. PAYROLL Generally, a Company paid salary at least once a month. An employer may deduct from an employee's salary
overpayments, or any sums payable by the employee to the employer under relations. The total amount of a lump-sum deduction from salary can't be
exceed 50%. TRAVEL POLICY Purpose & Scope 6 This Policy defines the specific rules to be followed when traveling on Company business. This
Policy also establishes guidelines to be followed to ensure that all business travel expenses incurred qualify for compensation or
reimbursement by Company and it applies to all Company employees. Authorization Each business trip must be authorized in advance by the
traveling employee's manager and/or functional supervisor (referred to hereinafter as the "Direct Manager") in writing or any other tangible
form that can evidence such approval and proof of such approval should be attached to the Travel Ticket in the Company intranet. Company
intends that a consistent and equitable practice with respect to the incurrence and compensation of business travel expenses be maintained
throughout Company. The Group CFO has final responsibility for interpretation of this Company Travel Policy. In case of necessity to
conduct a business meeting with representatives of the companies/partners of Company at the place of business trip, the cost
occurred will be reimbursed as provided for in Business Expense Policy. If an employee has any questions regarding reimbursement, they should
address them to the employee's Direct Manager. This Policy defines an allowable business trip expense as an expense incurred during the
business trip for a valid business purpose pre-approved by the Direct Manager. Any cost exceeding the set limits set forth in this Policy will
not be reimbursed to the employee. Any additional information and recommendations related to the content of this Policy and this Policy
itself may be found on the Wiki-page https://wiki.Company-team.ru/HR/travel-all/Oformlenie-komandirovokmezhdunarodnyx-ofisov/?from=%252Fusers%252Fmage-k%252Foformlenie-komandirovokmezhdunarodnyx-ofisov%252F
(referred to hereinafter as the "Wiki-page"). Economy Principle Business travel has to be planned, pre-approved and completed taking
into consideration the business needs of Company. Duration of the trip, mode of transportation and costs arising should be reasonable. All
business trips must be conducted as economically as possible always considering the purpose of the trip and its associated assignment.
Company employees are encouraged whenever possible to plan travel in advance avoiding last minute booking and unnecessary expenses. In an
effort to reduce costs, employees should first consider if a telephone, video or data conference call could be carried out instead of an on-site
meeting prior to making travel arrangements. For internal meetings, video or audio conferencing is preferred. Pre-Approval of Business Trips
7 The business trips are subject for pre-approval and following rules will be applied: • A Travel Approval Form should be completed prior to
the business trip. The form can be found here: https://forms.Company-team.ru/surveys/15789/?lang=en; and • Prior to the
business trip and to confirming with other attendees and making travel and accommodation arrangements, approval for the proposed business trip
should be obtained in writing or any other tangible form that can evidence such approval from an authorized manager in the Travel Ticket
in Company intranet. Employee's Business Travel The employee is responsible for communicating with the Company approved Travel Agency to
procure and/or book air, railway travel, hotel reservations, taking into account at all times the Economy Principle. The employee can do this by
following the directions described on the Wiki-page. Subject to prior approval by a Direct Manager and satisfaction of the other terms and
conditions of Company's travel policy, Company will directly paid the fees to an approved Travel Agency. The employee is responsible for
making all business travel arrangements, including: • Provision of required information; • Applying for and obtaining entry visa where
required; • Processing the most direct method of travel, considering possible alternatives; • Reservation and possible flight rebooking, with
best use of cost benefits and special offers; • Reservation of available appropriate cost-efficient accommodation. Adding Weekends to Business
Trips The employee may add weekends or vacation days to the business trip to spend some personal free time in the city of destination. Per
Diem allowance will not be paid by Company for leisure days added to a business trip. Company may agree with the employee on a case by case
basis to interrupt vacation due to business travel necessity or any other such reason. Sickness during the Business Trip In case of sick
leave during the business trip the employee is entitled to receive all mandatory payments due to them by law, subject to provision of the
proper sick leave certificate. Employees will be reimbursed reasonable cost for accommodation/hotel accommodation during his/her sickness
except the cases when the employee was in hospital. The employee will also continue to receive 8 the per diem allowance (please see further
below) for the whole period of the sick leave during the business trip. Company provides Employees with health insurance during foreign business
trips according to Company Policy. Intercity Travel and International Travel Company will pay or reimburse all expenses for intercity and
international travel to the destination and back, by all types of transport, in the amount of actual expenses confirmed by passenger, if
the employee books the ticket as described above taking into account the Economy Principle stated herein, but in any event not more than the cost
of the fare: By plane: • Economy-class (including one luggage item and cabin luggage) for the flight with total aggregate duration of less than
5 hours for any purposes; • Economy Class Plus or similar (higher than Economy Class, but lower than Business class) is permitted for flights
with total aggregate duration of more than 5 hours (within 24 hours from the departure time) for the purposes: of 1) business negotiations 2)
business meetings with colleagues in cities, where Company offices are located, 3) related to engineering and installation work, support for IT
infrastructure and logistics work at facilities, 4) of recruitment and hiring of employees, 5) Conferences if you are travelling as a speaker
or organizer. If case of absence the mentioned Classes on board, the employee's could booked a seats with the increased distance between the
seats, including near the emergency exit and such cost's will be reimbursed to the employee's; • Business Class is permitted for flights
with total aggregate durations of more than 5.5 hours (within 24 hours from the departure time) for the purposes: of 1) business negotiations
2) business meetings with collages in cities, where Company offices are located, 3) related to engineering and installation work, support for IT
infrastructure and logistics work at facilities, 4) of recruitment and hiring of employees, 5) Conferences if you are travelling as a speaker
or organizer. If case of absence the mentioned Classes on board, the employee's could booked a seats with the increased distance between the
seats, including near the emergency exit and such cost's will be reimbursed to the employee's; • Business Class is permitted also in
spite of purposes of travel and flight duration if the reason to book is related to a medical condition and the employee receive approval from
the Head of the office in writing in advance (in Travel Ticket). If an employee's travel is in connection with attendance at a conference or
seminar as a listener, only Economy Class is permitted, regardless of flight duration. By train -- according to the information on the
Wiki-page "Railway tickets" section. Tickets of a higher class than that allowed by this policy may be booked, but the employee shall pay the
difference between the cost of the higher class ticket and the class ticket allowed by this policy. Information about ticket classes can be
found on the Wiki-page. 9 Boarding passes and receipts shall be retained and submitted by the employee after the trip as proof that the booked
travel was completed. Intra-city travel during Business Trips The costs of travel to and from airports and railroad stations will be reimbursed
by Company taking into account the Economy Principle stated hereinabove (by way of example only, in Russia - Aeroexpress is limited to
"Standard"). The employee must retain and submit a receipt showing the fare paid. Company will reimburse the employee for the cost of parking
of his or her personal car in airport and railroad parking lots for 3 (three) days from the beginning of the business trip. Therefore, when a
business trip is scheduled to exceed 3 (three) days, the employee is expected to take a taxi, train, or other economical transportation to
the airport or rail station when possible. The employee must keep and submit all parking receipts. However, employees will not be paid a per
kilometer rate for personal car usage to and from an airport or railway station located in their city of residence or work. The costs of trips
within the city (including those from the hotel to the office) will not be reimbursed as they are included in the per diem allowance (please see
further below), unless such trips are to client or partner meetings. In cities where public transportation is limited or takes a considerable
amount of time (the list of such cities can be found on the Wiki-page), employees may rent a car if they received a prior approval from their
HR-BP or take a taxi if no prior approval is received. Car rental or taxi expenses are reimbursable upon submission of receipts. The car
rental is limited to economy or compact level. The use of a personal car on a domestic business trip is not recommended. Company will reimburse
the employee reasonable expenses only upon the approval of the Direct Manager and submission of a legitimate receipts. Accommodation Company
shall provide proper accommodation and equal conditions for all employees during their business trips, regardless of their department or
title. Employees shall be accommodated in single standard rooms of 4-star class hotels or hotels of medium price bracket for Russia and CIS
and 3 or 4-star class hotels or hotels of medium price bracket for other countries, if possible, not far from the place where all main events
attended shall be hosted (office, partner office, conference location, etc.) with a connection to the Internet. The list of Company recommended
hotels may be found on the wiki-page https://wiki.Company-team.ru/travel/Feedback/. Internet connection costs
are reimbursable unless a free internet connection is provided at the hotel. 10 The costs of all additional services (including, for example,
room service, mini-bar, fitness center, pay-perview movies, etc.) are not subject to reimbursement. If the employee used additional services,
the employee shall procure that two bills shall be issued at payment -- one for accommodation and the internet (to be reimbursed by Company) and
the other -- of all other additional services (not reimbursable). If the employee will pay expenses without detailed invoice, but with cash
receipt only (e.g. taxi fares, intra-city public transport fares), there are no further requirements for the content and format of such cash
receipt (usually, these receipts do not state any service recipient/addressee). Reimbursement for meals and incidental expenses A
per diem allowance has been established to compensate employees for travel within the city (as mentioned above) and to compensate for meals
during business trips. The per diem allowance includes the meal costs of the employee while on business trips, all subject to the per diem
allowance limits that can be found on the Wiki-page. Corporate card holders shall not use their cards to pay for personal meals. Per diem
allowances shall be paid for each day of the business trip from the day of departure through and including the day of return. Employees shall
not be compensated for any expenses incurred during days added to an employee's business trip for vacations or weekend leisure time. If
during a business trip three meals a day are provided at no expense to the employee, a per diem allowance for those days will not be paid.
Entertainment Company shall not reimburse expenses for personal entertainment (cinema, clubs, sporting events, etc.) during business
trips. For business-related entertainment expenses, please see Company's Business Expense Policy. Expense Reports To request
reimbursement, all authorized travel expenses must be itemized on the official Company's expense report form, found on the Wiki-page. Expense
reports must be signed by the employee and by the Direct Manager. Expense reports must be submitted together with receipts to support the
occurrence and business purpose of the expenses claimed for reimbursement. For business trips involving air transport, boarding
passes must also be submitted to support the dates of departure and arrival. 11 In the case of lost receipts or if supporting documentation
for expenses is not available, a memo specifying the expenses and reasons for the absence of supporting documents must be attached to the
expense report. If, in the reasonable opinion of the Direct Manager or the Head of Office (or his/her designee), the memorandum is not a
sufficient validation, the employee may be denied compensation for such undocumented expenses. Expense reports should be submitted by the end of
the month of returning from a business trip. If an expense report is not submitted within 45 (forty-five) days after returning from the business
trip, expenses will not be reimbursed. Employees are responsible for any delinquent charges incurred due to the lateness of submitting an expense
report. In addition, employees should always make and retain copies of submitted expense reports. Travel expenses incurred by the employee in
foreign currency during business trips abroad shall be compensated in the currency of the employee's salary at the rate of the Central Bank
of the country of location of the employee's permanent place of work as of the date of the expense occurred or at the rate of the card issuing
bank on the date of the occurred expense subject to receipt of a bank statement from the employee. Non-Reimbursable Expenses Purely personal
expenses incurred while traveling are not reimbursable by Company. The following is a partial listing of items that are considered
non-reimbursable: • Dues to airline clubs; • Fines for traffic violations while on Company business; • Purchases of clothing and other
personal items such as haircuts, shoe shines, newspapers, magazines, tobacco, alcohol, etc.; • Purchases of in-room movies and entertainment;
and • Any similar expenses. International travel expenses The following expenses shall be reimbursable for business trips requiring
international travel: • Expenses related to the issuance of visas or other documents required for entering and exiting foreign countries
during a business trip; and • Commissions and other payments charged by banks for withdrawal of cash via ATM, including in a currency other than
the bank account currency. 12 Procedures - Booking a Business Trip The procedures for booking a business trip by employees are as follows: 1.
Have the business trip (time, place, business purpose) approved in the Travel Ticket, including approval of the employee's plans to spend extra
days at the location of the business trip (if applicable); 2. Fill in a business trip request form available here
https://forms.Companyteam.ru/surveys/15789/?lang=en, and attach the aforementioned approval to the Travel Ticket; 3. Confirm his/her travel
itinerary and reservations with Travel Agency; and 4. Upon returning from the business trip the employee shall complete and submit an expense
report and supporting documentation through the Wiki-page. Final provisions In cases where the employee needs to make a business trip and
is not considered to be in management position such employee shall not be allowed to work on Saturday even if he/she stayed abroad. 13 BUSINESS
EXPENSE POLICY Expenses In the context of this Policy, expenses are considered to be necessary expenditures incurred by the Employees in
direct consequence of the discharge of the Employees' duties. The Employees are obliged to keep the expenses in the context of this Policy
as low as possible. Expenses must always be necessary, reasonable, appropriate and commensurate with business opportunity. Expenditures
which were not necessary or reasonable for the work performance shall not be paid by the Company but shall be borne by the Employees, subject
to applicable law. For business travel related expenses, please see Company's Business Travel Policy above. The following business expenses
are among those that may be reimbursed to the Employees: i. Representation expenses; ii. Travelling costs subject to the Company's
Travel Policy; iii. Corporate event expenses costs; and, iv. Other expenses. Principle of expense reimbursement As a matter of principle,
the expense report shall be made: • in the standard form specified by the corporate management; • according to actual expense incidents and
shall normally be compiled after the expense incident has ended, but at most within a month after the incident; and, • by providing original
receipts (such as receipts, receipted invoices, salesslips, and receipts for travel expenses) and shall be submitted together with the
corresponding receipts to the responsible superior for his approval and signature. Expenses must not be submitted for reimbursement as
case-based lump sums. All expenses (as prescribed by the current Policy) incurred by the Employees should be reimbursed and/or submitted for
reimbursement upon final approval by the Head of Office. The expense reimbursement will be provided to the Employee in the next payroll
following approval. Representation expenses In the context of customer care as well as public relations with third parties close to the
Company, it can be in the interest of the Company for Employees to invite such third parties to attend certain events and/or to entertain
such third parties. Generally, a certain restraint shall be applied when it comes to such invitations. The costs incurred shall always be
determined by the business interest. When selecting localities for such invitations, the business importance of the customers or business
partners as well as the local customs shall be taken into consideration. The actual costs of reasonable representation expenses shall be
reimbursed. Employees must obtain approval from Reporting Manager for all business entertainment expenses. The following details shall be
noted when submitting the original receipt: 14 1. the business purpose of the meeting; 2. the date of the meeting; 3. name and place of the
restaurant; 4. the names of Employees and partner participants attending the meeting; and, 5. the name of the participating companies. Daily
limits per person As a general rule, the following daily limits apply on the representation expenses: Turkey: 120 TRY; USA: 70 USD; Russia
(Moscow, Saint Petersburg): 3000 RUR; Russia (except Moscow, Saint Petersburg), Belarus, Kazakhstan, Ukraine: 2000 RUR (in local currency);
Switzerland: 90 CHF; Europe: 65 EUR; Other countries: 70 USD. In exceptional cases only, it may be reasonable for representation expenses
to exceed the abovementioned daily allowance limits. In those circumstances, the Head of Departments' written pre-approval of the
representation expenses is necessary. Other expenses in case it is necessary to compensate other expenses not covered by this Policy (due
to business needs), a pre-approval from Reporting Manager and/or Head of Department must be obtained whether in writing or any other form that
can be used as evidence. After having received the pre-approval from the Reporting Manager and/or Head of Department, the respective expenses
will be reimbursed after original receipts are provided. All documents including the receipts should be provided to the office manager.
Corporate gifts The Company does not approve of giving any corporate gifts with the exception of Company souvenirs of nominal value. Company
souvenirs may be obtained by contacting a responsible person for marketing events. CORPORATE CARD EXPENSES A Corporate credit card may be
issued to the Employee subject to the approval of the Head of Department and any other authorized person and acceptance by the Employee of the
Company's Corporate Card Expenses. 15 Corporate credit cards shall be used only for reimbursable representative and other business-related
expenses described in this Policy. Use of a corporate credit card for personal expenses is strictly prohibited. As corporate credit card
purchases are made, the Employee shall promptly submit the associated expense report to the Company for reimbursement by the Company but not
later than 10 business days after the end of the reporting month. While a third-party vendor may be engaged by the Company to facilitate expense
report generation via electronic system (by receiving purchase information directly from the credit card financial institution), the
Employee is ultimately responsible for timely expense report submission to such electronic system. Accordingly, the Employee will be responsible
for paying any fee, penalty, or interest associated with untimely corporate credit card payment due to the breach of this Policy or the
Company's Corporate Credit Card Use Agreement, barring unusual circumstances and subject to applicable law. It is clarified that any
such fee, penalty or interest shall be considered as debt to the Company, and shall be deducted from the Employee's salary accordingly,
in accordance with applicable law. In accepting a Company-issued credit card, the Employee is authorizing release and disclosure of all personal
information associated with the issuance and use of the card (including but not limited to information related to purchases such as date,
location, purchase amount, merchant, etc.) to the Company and to any third-party vendor engaged by the Company for the purpose of
facilitating expense report generation. Accordingly, Employees, who accept a corporate credit card should have no expectation of privacy of
information related to the issuance and/or use of a corporate credit card. Company approval for issuance and use of a corporate credit card
is a discretionary privilege of employment, not an entitlement, and the Company may revoke its approval at any time. Employee is required to
return the credit card to the Company and cease use of the corporate credit card immediately upon request by the Company. In addition, all
corporate credit cards must be returned to the Company upon notice of termination or resignation and not used by an Employee following notice
of termination or resignation. All responsible persons mentioned in this Policy and the Policy itself may be found on the following link: 16
ANTI-HARASSMENT Company is committed to providing a work environment that is free of unlawful harassment and discrimination. In keeping with
this commitment and applicable law, Company prohibits sexual harassment and harassment on any other basis. All harassment is unlawful.
Company's anti-harassment policies apply to all persons involved in the operation of Company and prohibit unlawful harassment by any employee of
Company, including supervisors and managers, as well as vendors, customers and any other persons. Prohibited unlawful harassment
includes, but is not limited to, the following behavior: 1) Verbal conduct such as epithets, derogatory jokes or comments, slurs or
unwanted advances, invitations or comments; 2) Visual displays such as derogatory posters, photography, cartoons, drawings or gestures; 3)
Physical conduct including assault, unwanted touching or intentionally blocking normal movement; 4) Threats and demands to submit to requests
irrelevant to normal business activity as a condition of continued employment, or to avoid some other loss and offers of employment
benefits in return for irrelevant favors; and 5) Retaliation for reporting or threatening to report harassment. Internal Complaint
Procedure Company will carry out a prompt, thorough, and objective investigation of any claim of harassment and will take appropriate
disciplinary action against one found to engage in prohibited harassment. If you believe you have been harassed on the job, or if you
are aware of the harassment of others, you should provide a written or verbal complaint to https://Company.alertline.eu as soon as possible.
Your complaint should be as detailed as possible, including the names of individuals involved, the names of any witnesses, direct quotations when
language is relevant, and any documentary evidence (notes, pictures, cartoons, et cetera). If Company determines that harassment has
occurred, Company will take effective remedial action commensurate with the circumstances. Any employee determined by Company to be responsible
for harassment will be subject to appropriate disciplinary action up to and including, termination. A Company representative will advise all
parties concerned of the results of the investigation. Company will not retaliate against you for filing a complaint in good faith and will not
tolerate or permit retaliation by management, employees or co-workers. Company encourages all employees to report any incidents of harassment
forbidden by this policy so that complaints can be quickly and fairly resolved. 17 PERSONAL INFORMATION Updating Personal Information Upon
their start at Company, employees receive a 101 form to fill out, detailing all their personal information. The same form is given at the
start of every year in order to make Company aware of any changes in family status, address, etc. Employees are responsible to notify Company
of any personal changes, including but not limited to addresses, telephone numbers, number of dependents, change in marital status or
other personal information so that Company may keep personnel records accurate and up-date and so that Company can communicate with employees
as needed. Personnel Records & Confidentiality Personnel records, including medical information about an employee connected with the
possibility to work, are confidential. Access will generally be limited only to those who have a need to know the information. Under some
circumstances, Company may be required to provide personnel records by law, in response to a court order or for other legitimate business
purposes in strict compliance with applicable law. Employees may review their personnel records at a mutually convenient time during business
hours and may add additional items to the file. Any concerns regarding the completeness or accuracy of the information contained in the
personnel file should be discussed with the employee's supervisor or HR personnel. 18 COMMUNICATIONS The provisions of this policy are in
addition to the employee's obligations under the Employment Agreement and its Appendixes. External Communications Employees occasionally may
be contacted by outside third parties, including the media and attorneys, requesting information about Company. Employees contacted by
an outside third party should immediately refer the outside third party to their supervisor. Employees must not provide any information
concerning Company unless authorized to do so in writing by a member of Executive Management. Requests for job references or employment
verifications for current or former employees must be forwarded to the HR department. Employees outside of the HR department must not provide
references or employment verifications for current or past employees. Electronic Communications This policy sets forth general principles to
be applied to use of Electronic Media, including, but not limited to, Confidential Information (as defined in the Employment Agreement),
computers, e-mail, telephones, cellular phone, voicemail, fax machines, external electronic bulletin boards, on-line services, communication
equipment, software, hardware, programs, applications, the Internet, all electronic media and services which are accessed on or from Company
premises, accessed using, or via company-paid access methods and/or used in a manner which identifies the individual with Company. Personal Use
of the Electronic Media: The Electronic Media provided by Company is intended for Company business use only and the employee shall not use it
for personal purposes and shall have no right of privacy with respect to it. Company reserves the right, to the greatest extent permissible by
law, to monitor, block, access and disclose all data on Electronic Media, and may use monitoring, tracking, storage, backup tools etc. Any
employee abusing the privilege of company-facilitated access to Electronic Media will be subject to disciplinary action. Prohibited Use
of Electronic Media: Company's Electronic Media should not be used for a personal purpose or for the advancement of individual views. Employees
who wish to express personal opinions on the internet are encouraged to obtain a personal account with a commercial internet service provider
and to access the internet without using Company resources. Employee postings are not permitted on Company's Intranet or electronic bulletin
board. Each employee is responsible for the content of all text, audio, or images that they place or send over Company's Electronic Media.
Employees may access only files or programs, whether computerized or not, that they have permission to enter. 19 Right to Access Information
- No Right of Privacy: The Electronic Media have been installed by
Company to facilitate business communications. Although each employee has an individual password to access the systems, the communications and
the password belong to Company. Company reserves the right, to the greatest extent permissible by law, in its discretion and without
employee permission, to review any Electronic Media provided by Company, including but not limited to, employee's electronic files, e-mail
messages and Internet usage to the extent necessary to ensure that Electronic Media is being used in compliance with the law and with
Company policies. Company respects the individual privacy of its employees. However, employee privacy does not extend to the employee's
work-related conduct or to the use of Company-provided Electronic Media. Therefore, employees should never assume data and communications on
Company provided Electronic Media are private and confidential. In order to facilitate Company's access to information on its resources,
employees may not encrypt or encode any voicemail or email communication or any other files or data stored or exchanged on Company systems
without the express prior written permission from the IT Department. As part of this approval, the IT Department will indicate a procedure for
you to deposit any password, encryption key or code, or software with the IT Department so that the encrypted or encoded information can be
accessed in employees' absence. Copyrighted Materials: Employees should not copy and distribute copyrighted material (e.g., software, database
files, documentation, articles, graphics files, and downloaded information) through the email system or by any other means unless
employees have confirmed in advance from appropriate sources that Company has the right to copy or distribute the material. Failure to
observe a copyright may result in disciplinary action by Company as well as legal action by the copyright owner. Any questions concerning these
rights should be directed to the Legal Department. Cellular Telephones: Company may provide some employees with cellular telephones and/or
service plans in order to enhance their productivity and work on behalf of Company. Such cell phones should be treated as the property of
Company and all Company policies apply with respect to their use. Software Policy If an employee wants to install software on Company
computers, such employee must contact the IT Department and request to have the software installed. Employees are prohibited from installing
any software on any Company technical resource without the express prior written permission from the IT Department. Involving the IT Department
ensures that Company can manage the software on Company systems, prevent the introduction of computer viruses, and meet its obligations under any
applicable software licenses and copyright laws. Employees may not load personal software onto Company's systems and may not copy software from
Company for personal use. Any questions regarding Company's software policy should be directed to the IT Department. 20 Hardware Policy
Employees should contact IT Department regarding purchasing and/or adding computer hardware relating to, among other things, desktop and
portable computer systems, Web access, email, internet/electronic bulletin boards and Intranet(s). Additional Policies Regarding Company
or/Professional Use of Social Media • Employees may use social media as part of their job duties, including LinkedIn, Facebook or similar
professional networking sites. In these instances, such employees may use Company resources and time. • Employees should ensure that
professional use of social media and proposed content complies with Company policies, and preserves confidential/proprietary information of
Company, and is otherwise appropriate in tone or content before posting. • Employees should respect all copyright and other intellectual property
laws. For Company's protection as well as your own, it is critical that you show proper respect for the laws governing copyright, fair use of
copyrighted material owned by others, trademarks, and other intellectual property, including Company's own copyrights, trademarks, and brands. •
No one may speak on behalf of Company without advance approval from Company Executive Management. Personal Telephone Calls Employees are
expected to limit personal telephone calls to urgent matters. Employees are prohibited from using Company telephones for personal International
calls. 21 END OF EMPLOYMENT General Generally speaking, employment with Company may end either by the employee's resignation (when the employee
initiates the end of the employment relationship), or by termination (when Company initiates the end of the employment relationship). Expiry
of Fixed Term Employment Often, if a fixed term employment expires and is not renewed, a similar process must be taken. Seek legal advice
before the expiry of a fixed term employment. Resignation If an employee decides to resign he must provide a written resignation letter to his
supervisor. Employee must notify Company about the resignation in advance at least 30 calendar days in advance. It is recommended that the
resignation letter include the name and ID number of the employee, the date on which it is presented to the supervisor, the date of the end of
employment (after the relevant notice period). The letter may or may not include the reasons for resigning. Company may accept resignation that
does not include all the above details. The Parties may decide that the employee will not attend work or will work partially during the notice
period, but the employee will be paid his regular salary, without deducting vacation days for such nonattendance. Inability to Work If the
employee is incapable of working, due to physical or mental disability, incarceration or other circumstances, please seek legal advice. End of
Employment Process HR personnel will conduct a meeting with the employee to present information with respect to the employee's entitlements.
Company will provide the written notice of the term of employment required by law. The written notice will include the date of
commencement of the employment and the last date of employment. There is no requirement to state any additional information, such as the
employee's position. The employee must return all of Company's property and must have the people indicated by HR personnel (depending on the
items of property to be returned) sign to acknowledge receipt of such property. Company will provide the employee with the documentation
necessary to release the severance pay and pension funds, other than under extreme circumstances and pursuant to legal advice. Company will
provide the employee the tax forms required upon end of employment

country: Turkey topic: Additional Financial Support Turkey
- Each of us can get into a difficult life situation.\
If this happens, we are ready to support you emotionally and try to help you financially.

### Additional financial support could be paid in the following cases:

##### Death of a close relative

Parents, spouse, children, brothers and sisters are considered as close relatives. In some cases, grandparents are also could be considered as
close relatives, for example, if they adopted an employee or if the main parent is absent or lost. If more than one member of your family works
in the company, the payment is due to one person.

##### Additional financial support for the parents of disabled children

If you have disabled children you can get this type of additional financial support once per year.

##### In other force majeure situations

Please choose option «Other» and give us more details in a commentary filling out the form.

You can also contact your HR partner for any questions.

- # Offboarding

## How to

| +------------------------------------------------------------------+ |
|  |**1**|  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Talk to your manager to confirm the date of resignation |  |
| +==================================================================+ |
| +------------------------------------------------------------------+ |
|**2**|
|  |
| [Create a ticket](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/surveys/137377/) and |
| attach your wet-signed [resignation |
| letter](https://jing.yandex- |
| team.ru/files/annaparchim/Tu%CC%88rkiye_resignation%20letter%20.docx) |
|**3**|
|  |
|**Provide wet-signed hard copy of the resignation letter to HR at the |
| office or ask a right |
| contac |
| t [Helpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot)**|**4**Finalize pending expense reports**5**Return company's assets at the last date

| +------------------------------------------------------------------+ |
|  |**6**|  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Receive final payment and all necessary certificates |  |
| +==================================================================+ |
| +------------------------------------------------------------------+ |
## Key Points**Payment**Your final payment will be paid on the last business day of last working
month.

We will pay your salary and all the benefits you are entitled, accrued up until your last day.

Do not hesitate to reach out to [Helpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot) for
any questions regarding payroll.

|**Life Insurance**|  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |
| Your health and life insurance (Workplace accident insurance) will |  |  |
| end at the next day after resignation. |  |  |
|  |  |  |
| Please reach out |  |  |
| to [Helpy] |  |  |
| (https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot) regarding |  |  |
| to your insurance details, or to answer any of your questions. |  |  |
| #### Final documentation |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |
| In your last day of work you will receive the |  |  |
| following documentation in the office: |  |  |
|  |  |  |
| > |  |  |
|  |  |  |
| - payslip for current month; |  |  |
|  |  |  |
| - a certificate indicating the total tax base. |  |  |
|  |  |  |
| If you work online, we will send you a scan via email and the |  |  |
| original one via post/courier service. |  |  |
#### Resignation ticket

To create a ticket for your resignation, fill in the [form](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/surveys/137377/).

Please specify the date of resignation in the form, approved by your manager and attach your signed resignation letter.

Please note that notice periods must be served/observed:
- 2 weeks for up to 6 months of service
- 4 weeks for service of 6 months -- 1.5 years
- 6 weeks for service of 1.5 years -- 3 years
- 8 weeks for more than 3 years of service.

|**Expense reports**|  |  |
|  |  |  |
| You must make sure you have submitted all outstanding expenses |  |  |
| before you leave. |  |  |
|  |  |  |
| Expense report instruction can be |  |  |
| found [here |  |  |
| ](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/finances/business-e |  |  |
| xpenses/kak-otchitatsja-po-rasxodam-inostrannye-jur-lica-h/).\ |  |  |
| We highly recommend you submitting expense reports in advance. |  |  |
| +---------------------------------------------------+------+ |  |  |
|  |**Company's assets**|  |  |  |  |
|  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Information is being finalized. |  |  |  |  |
| +===================================================+======+ |  |  |
| +---------------------------------------------------+------+ |  |  |
|  |  |  |
| +---------------------------------------------------+------+ |  |  |
|  |**Accesses**|  |  |  |  |
|  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Information is being finalized. |  |  |  |  |
| +===================================================+======+ |  |  |
| +---------------------------------------------------+------+ |  |  |
## FAQ

#### How can I create a ticket to apply for resignation?

Please fill in [the form](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/surveys/137377/) and attach your
resignation letter. The ticket will be automatically generated, HR Admin will contact you via the ticket if any additional information is needed.

#### Is this possible to receive a reference letter?

If you need a reference letter, please contact support via [Helpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot).

#### Can I receive a Job certificate?

If you would like to have a Job certificate on English or Turkish, please contact support
via [\@YandexHelpDeskbot](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot) a few days in advance of your resignation date.

#### How can I contact HR after the termination date?

Please send an email with your question on <helpy@yandex-team.ru>

#### Can I buy company's equipment?

There are some rules. More information is [here](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/pokupka/dismissal/). To transalte
the page on English please click on the globe.

This document provides information about medical insurance coverage for Yandex employees in Turkey, including benefits, covered services, and how to access healthcare providers.

country: Turkey topic: Medical Insurance Turkey
- Medical insurance is provided to full-time Yandex employees in
accordance with the corporate rules. The insurance program covers planned and emergency medical care services.

According to the insurance program, you can contact a commercial clinic convenient for you from [the
list](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://www.allianz.com.tr/tr_TR/anlasmali-kurumlar/anlasmali-saglik-kurumlari.html%23/), and the insurance company will cover the costs that are included in the
plan.

Details of insurance for spouses and children at preferential rates are available on [this
page](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/hr/kompensacii/benefity-v-turcii/straxovanie-v-turcii/medical-insurance-in-turkey/family-members-insurance/).

#### Insurance Company

![](media/image1.png){width="6.496527777777778in" height="3.654166666666667in"}

### General rules**\
1.**Only medical insurance is available for purchase.**2.**Insurance for relatives can start on the same day as the
employee's insurance (exceptions are newlyweds and newborns).**3.**The insurance can start either on the 1st or on 15th day of the month.**4.**You can't cancel dependent's insurance upon request till the
end of insurance period.

#### 5. When an employee leaves the company dependents' insurance is cancelled from the 1st day of the next month after the dismissal.

####

### Insurance plan

#### Most of the services under the insurance plan are carried out with 20% copayment from the insured. In contracted clinics (see the list below) the insured will be asked to cover only 20% of the cost; in the out-of-network clinics the services will be payed by the insured in full with an 80% reimbursement from the insurance company upon request (the details are in the attached file below)

### How to add family member

You can take advantage of special insurance conditions for official spouses and children (from 0 to 24 years old). The company covers 80% of
the insurance cost. Employee is to pay 20% though monthly deductions from salary. The insurance plans for an employee and their family
members are the same.

Insurance for relatives can start only on the same day as the employee's insurance. Please submit a request in the questionnaire from
the insurance company before the start of your own insurance. The local HR will contact you to sign a legal document to process deductions from
your salary.

### General rules**\
1.**Only medical insurance is available for purchase.**2.**Insurance for relatives can start on the same day as the
employee's insurance (exceptions are newlyweds and newborns).**3.**The insurance can start either on the 1st or on 15th day of the month.**4.**You can't cancel dependent's insurance upon request till the
end of insurance period.**5.**When an employee leaves the company dependents' insurance is cancelled from the 1st day of the next month after the dismissal.

# Region: Asia, Country: Turkey, Topic: Payroll

This document provides information about payroll procedures for Yandex employees in Turkey, including salary payment schedules, taxes, and related processes.

toolUseResult.originalFileContents:
---
region: Asia
country: Turkey
topic: Payroll Turkey
---

# Payroll

**Salary**

Salary payment is once a month, it is paid at the last business day, and sometimes can be paid a couple of days earlier.

At the day of payment or maximum 2 days after you will receive a payslip with a payment breakdown. If you have any doubts about received amounts you can always raise your question via [Helpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot).

**Taxes and contributions**

Turkish legislation has a progressive rate of income tax. The rate is from 0 to 40% and depends on your annual income. The income tax is deductible from your income.

**Reimbursement**

Your expenses may be reimbursed if they are related to business needs. When expense is approved by your manager, it is passed to the accountant who makes such payment in regular days, but not on the salary day.

To know how to reimburse click [here](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/finances/business-expenses/kak-otchitatsja-po-rasxodam-inostrannye-jur-lica-h/). If you do not have access to this page, you need to request for it.

## FAQ

#### How can I update my bank details in systems?

Please fill out [this form](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/surveys/160874/) to change your bank details.

#### How was my KPI bonus calculated?

The amount of your bonuses is given by your manager and approved by your HR BP, so that we would recommend you contact them accordingly. If you still have doubts, please reach out support team via [Helpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot).

#### Who is my manager?

Your manager according to organizational chart is shown as Head on your [Staff](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/).

#### Who is my HR BP?

Your HR BP is shown as HR-partner on your [Staff](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/).

country: Turkey topic: Мат Помощь Турция
- #### Материальная помощь

Каждый из нас может попасть в сложную жизненную ситуацию.\ Если так произошло, мы готовы поддержать вас эмоционально и постараемся
помочь финансово.

### В каких случаях мы можем помочь

##### В случае смерти близкого родственника

Близкими родственниками считаются супруги, дети, братья и сёстры, родители (либо официальные опекуны при потере основного родителя). В
некоторых случаях бабушка или дедушка тоже относятся к близким родственникам, если они усыновили или удочерили сотрудника или в случае
отсутствия или потери основного родителя.

Материальная помощь по случаю смерти родственника выплачивается, если смерть родственника случилась в любое время в течение работы сотрудника
в компании.

Если в компании работает больше одного члена вашей семьи, выплата полагается кому-то одному.

##### Материальная помощь для родителей детей-инвалидов

Если у вас есть дети-инвалиды в возрасте до 18 лет включительно, один раз в год можно получить данный вид материальной помощи.

Повторная выплата производится через год после даты последней выплаты.

##### В других сложных и форс-мажорных ситуациях

Расскажите подробнее в комментарии, выбрав тип «Другое» в заявке.

По всем вопросам вы можете также обратиться к своему HR-партнеру.

- ДМС от компании «Allianz» --- добровольное медицинское страхование,
которое предоставляется штатным сотрудникам Яндекса на основном месте трудоустройства.

По ДМС вы можете обратиться в удобную вам коммерческую клинику из [списка](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://www.allianz.com.tr/tr_TR/anlasmali-kurumlar/anlasmali-saglik-kurumlari.html%23/),
а страховая компания оплатит расходы, которые входят в программу.

Детали страхования супругов и детей на льготных условиях доступны [на странице](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/hr/kompensacii/benefity-v-turcii/straxovanie-v-turcii/straxovanie-rodstvennikov/).

### Правила страхования**1.**Полис ежегодно обновляется в конце периода страхования --- 1
августа.\ Вы узнаете про обновление из корпоративной рассылки.**2.**При увольнении сотрудника из компании страхование прекращается на
следующий календарный день после увольнения.

### Программа страхования**Обновление программы с 1 августа 2024 года**| --- увеличены лимиты на стоматологию и офтальмологию с 5 000 TRY до 8 |
| 500 TRY в год |
|  |
| --- расширено [наполнение |
| чекапа](http |
| s://jing.yandex-team.ru/files/nepoklonnova/Check-up%20%28RUS%29.xlsx) |
|  |
| --- увеличены суммы выплат при страховании от несчастных случаев --- |
| теперь это один годовой оклад. |
Турецкий рынок страхования работает с обязательной оплатой 20% всех основных расходов застрахованным самостоятельно. При обращении в клиники
прямого доступа (Contracted Clinics, можно найти по ссылке ниже) застрахованный оплачивает по факту получения услуг только 20%. При
обращении в клиники, с которыми у страховой компании нет прямых договоров, застрахованным оплачивается вся стоимость услуг, а далее
компенсируется 80% через страховую компанию.**Какие услуги потребуют оплаты 20% стоимости**| - Приёмы врачей в клиниках | - |

31.07.2025.

### Страхование от несчастных случаев (НС)

Для застрахованных сотрудников полис страхования от НС оформляется вместе с полисом ДМС, а его срок действия такой же. При наступлении
страхового события полагается выплата страховой суммы.

Страхование от несчастных случаев включает следующие риски:
- Смерть в результате несчастного случая и (или) болезни
- Инвалидность, установленная в результате несчастного случая или
болезни
- Травматическое повреждение в результате несчастного случая

#### Максимальная сумма выплаты**Годовой оклад сотрудника********Сумма страховой выплаты может быть рассчитана как процент от
максимальной\ в зависимости от страхового события.

### Страхование в поездках (полис ВЗР)

Полис выезжающего за рубеж (ВЗР) --- один из видов страхования, который нужен для защиты здоровья во время поездок за границу. Полис входит в
программу ДМС застрахованных сотрудников.

Полис действует только в течение первых 90 дней непрерывного пребывания в одной стране.

В полис включено покрытие только медицинских расходов, связанных с оказанием срочной амбулаторной или стационарной помощи, транспортировкой
по медицинским показаниям, экстренной стоматологией. Полис покрывает занятия спортом -- подробнее можно
узнать [здесь](https://jing.yandex-team.ru/files/evteevda/TurkeySports%20nActivities%20covered.xlsx).

Полис запрашивается для каждой поездки минимум за 3 дня до даты поездки через заявку у страхового брокера. В заявке необходимо указать ФИО, даты
и страны поездки. Для этого напишите \@jennety

 Полис ВЗР не работает в стране, в которой у вас есть ВНЖ или гражданство.

#### Страховая сумма**500 000 EUR**##### Как получить медицинскую помощь по полису ВЗР**1.**Позвоните в круглосуточный колл-центр «Assistance Hotline»: +1
888 439 1.**2.**Назовите оператору ФИО, номер полиса (если есть под рукой), дату рождения и расскажите, какая именно помощь требуется.**3.**Оставьте контактные данные, по которым можно оперативно связаться
с вами или родственниками.**4.**Оператор зафиксирует обращение и вернется с обратной связью по дальнейшим шагам.

##### Компенсация расходов по полису ВЗР

В зависимости от страны пребывания оплата услуг предоставляться только в формате последующей компенсации расходов.

Форму для возмещения расходов через страховую компанию и контакты можно найти [здесь](https://jing.yandex-team.ru/files/evteevda/TurkeyTravel_Claim%20form.pdf)

### Когда начнёт работать страховка

Все штатные сотрудники при оформлении по основному месту работы в Турции будут застрахованы по ДМС, страхованию от несчастных случаев в течение
месяца с даты приема на работу. Для начала страхования необходимо пройти анкетирование от страховой компании (отправляется страховой компанией
ссылкой в сообщении на предоставленный вами номер телефона), после чего электронный полис и инструкции будут направлены на рабочий email
сотрудника. Страхование ВЗР подключается строго под даты поездки.

При увольнении сотрудника из компании страхование прекращается на следующий календарный день после увольнения.

### Контакты

#### Корпоративный страховой брокер**Страховой брокер:**Nart

Обращение только на английском или турецком языках.**Вопросы по программе страхования и покрытия**(включая возмещение расходов)**Gamze İnli Yakut****Tel.:**+90 (850) 724 63 59 / 0530 167 02 58**E-mail:**[gamzeyakut@nart.com](mailto:aylasaktopel@nart.com)**Горячая линия «Allianz Sigorta»**-----------------------------------------------------------------------**Tel.: 0850 399 9999**-----------------------------------------------------------------------

  -----------------------------------------------------------------------
