When expense is approved by your manager, it is passed to the | | 179 | accountant who makes such payment in regular days, but not on the | | 180 | salary day. | | 181 | | | 182 | To know how to reimburse | | 183 | click [here](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/finances/bus | | 184 | iness-expenses/kak-otchitatsja-po-rasxodam-inostrannye-jur-lica-h/). | | 185 | If you do not have access to this page, you need to request for it. | |**Health and safety****What is EHS?**EHS stands for Environment, Health, and Safety. It is a 186 multidisciplinary field that focuses on managing and ensuring the well-being of individuals and the protection of the environment within 187 various settings, including workplaces, communities, and public spaces. EHS encompasses a wide range of practices, policies, and regulations 188 that aim to prevent accidents, injuries, and illnesses while minimizing the negative impact on the environment. 189 190 The primary objectives of EHS are to create safe and healthy working conditions, promote sustainable practices, and comply with legal 191 requirements to safeguard both employees and the surrounding environment. By integrating these three essential components -- 192 Environment, Health, and Safety -- organizations can proactively identify and mitigate potential hazards, reduce risks, and enhance 193 overall performance. 194 195 Key aspects of EHS include: 196 1. Environment: This aspect addresses the impact of human activities on 197 the natural world. It involves assessing and managing issues such as air and water quality, waste management, energy efficiency, and the 198 conservation of natural resources. By implementing environmentally responsible practices, organizations can contribute to a greener and 199 more sustainable future. 200 2. Health: EHS aims to protect the health and well-being of 201 individuals, whether they are employees, customers, or residents of nearby communities. This involves identifying workplace hazards, 202 promoting healthy behaviors, providing proper training, and offering access to medical services to prevent and address illnesses and 203 injuries. 204 3. Safety: Safety is a fundamental aspect of EHS, focusing on 205 preventing accidents and injuries in various settings. Workplace safety measures can include ergonomic assessments, machine guarding, 206 safety training, and emergency preparedness to ensure the physical well-being of employees and visitors. 207 208 Adopting a robust EHS program not only helps organizations maintain a positive reputation but also enhances productivity and efficiency by 209 reducing downtime due to accidents or environmental incidents. Additionally, it demonstrates a commitment to social responsibility and 210 sustainability, which is increasingly important in today's world. 211 212 Overall, EHS plays a vital role in maintaining a healthy workforce, protecting the environment, and contributing to the long-term success 213 and resilience of businesses and communities alike.**Courses**[**Course health safety at work in English**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HESAWORK19) 214 215 [**Course health safety at work in Georgian**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_GE) 216 217 [**Course health safety at work in Armenian**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_HY) 218 219 [**Course health safety at work in Spanish**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_ES) 220 221 [**Course health safety at work in Azerbaijani**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_AZ) 222 223 [**Course health safety at work in Turkish**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_TR) 224 225 [**Course health safety at work in French**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_FR) 226 227 [**Course health safety at work in Arabian**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_AR) 228 229 [**Covid-19 info course**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/010203)**Risk reduction**Assessment of professional risks 230 231 Identification of hazards: identify potential hazards in the office, including ergonomic issues, electrical malfunctions, and chemical 232 exposures (detecting all risks related to equipment, environment, or processes). 233 234 Risk Evaluation: analyzing the likelihood and severity of harm from each hazard - use checklists, inspections, and incident reports to assess 235 risks (Tickets system in Yango). 236 237 Risk reduction measures: developing strategies to minimize risks, such as safety protocols, training, and protective measures as well as 238 implement engineering controls, administrative policies, and personal protective equipment to mitigate identified risks. 239 240 Risks hunting 241 242 Reporting safety concerns is crucial for maintaining a secure workplace. Employees can promptly identify and report hazards through the HSE 243 reporting form: 244 245 [  HSE risks hunting (en)](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/ext/surveys/13704655/) 246 247 This proactive approach helps the HSE team investigate and implement corrective actions, preventing future incidents. Open communication 248 fosters a culture of safety and ensures timely resolution of issues, protecting everyone in the workplace. 249 250 Near Miss 251 252 Near miss is an unplanned event that didn't result in injury, illness or damage -- but had the potential to do so. 253 254 Hazard communication 255 256 Hazard communication ensures that employees are informed about potential risks in the workplace. Open communication channels allow employees to 257 report and address hazards promptly. 258 259 By promoting transparency and awareness, hazard communication helps prevent accidents and fosters a safer work environment where everyone 260 understands and complies with safety protocols. 261 262 Information about risks 263 264 Employees receive timely information about risks through: 265 - Security guides 266 - Meetings and trainings 267 - Information materials in public places 268 - Wiki pages 269 - Safety signs 270 - Briefings 271 - Documents, tickets and feedback 272 - Registers with employee signatures 273 - Feedback channels 274 275 Yango has internally established protocols for quickly informing employees about risks and dangers. In addition, in each country we 276 organize internal emergency services from volunteers for timely monitoring and management of emergency situations, evacuations and first 277 aid. 278 279 Please report near miss directly via hse@yango.com**Contacts**If you have any questions, concerns, or suggestions regarding health, safety, or environmental issues, please don't hesitate to reach out to 280 the HSE team.**[Вера Коншина](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/verakonshina) - Head of HSE department**\**[Мария Валиева](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/valievamv) - HSE 281 specialist**We are here to support you, address your concerns, and help ensure a safe and healthy working environment for everyone. 282 283 Your feedback and observations are invaluable in maintaining a culture of safety and continuous improvement. Let's work together to keep our 284 workplace safe!\ \**Ergonomics\**The goal of our Ergonomics Program is to improve system and task 285 design so that safety, health, comfort, and performance is maintained. Many factors play a role in ergonomics. These include body posture and 286 movement (e.g., sitting, standing, lifting, pulling, and pushing), environmental factors (e.g., noise, vibration, illumination, climate) 287 and processing of information (i.e., gained visually or through other senses). 288 289 Risk factors include: 290 - Sustained or awkward body postures 291 - Excessive repetitive motions 292 - Excessive or sustained force 293 - Mechanical or contact stress 294 - Muscle tension**Prevention is key. Here are some suggestions and tools to help you 295 avoid ergonomic issues:**- [Ergonomic Guidelines for Setting up Your Computer Workstation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F8_ME4VwTiw) 296 - [Office Ergonomics: Simple solutions for comfort and 297 safety](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ofnpBtO1-gA) 298 - -----------------------------------------------------------------------**Payroll**----------------------------------------------------------------------- Here is the information about salary payments in Chile. ----------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------**If you have questions regarding salary payments, please [**Ask a reach out to a support team**Question**](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot) ----------------------------------------------------------- -- ----------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | +- | | +------------------------------+ | | ---------------------------+---+ | | |**Taxes and contributions**| | | | | | | | | |**Salary**| | | | | According to Chilean law, | | | | | | | you must pay an amount for | | | | | | | | the "ISAPRE" (Salud), | | | | | | | "Prevision", "Impuesto | | | Salary payment is once a | | | | | Único" and "Seguro | | | | | | | Cesantia". The amounts will | | | month, it is paid at the | | | | | be deducted from your salary | | | | | | | at the end of each month. | | | last business day, and | | | | +==============================+ | | | | | +------------------------------+ | | sometimes can be paid a | | | | | | | | | | | couple of days earlier. | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | At the day of payment you | | | | | | | | | | | will receive a payslip | | | | | | | | | | | with a payment breakdown. | | | | | | | | | | | If you have any doubts | | | | | | | | | | | about received amounts you | | | | | | | | | | | can always raise your | | | | | | | | | | | question | | | | | | | | | | | via [Helpy](https: | | | | | | | | | | | //h.yandex-team.ru/?https: | | | | | | | | | | | //t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot). | | | | | | += | | | | ===========================+===+ | | | | +- | | | | ---------------------------+---+ | | | |**Reimbursement**| | | --- | --- | | | | | Your expenses may be reimbursed if they are related to business | | | needs. When expense is approved by your manager, it is passed to the | | | accountant who makes such payment in regular days, but not on the | | | salary day. | | | | | | To know how to reimburse | | | click [here](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/finances/bus | | | iness-expenses/kak-otchitatsja-po-rasxodam-inostrannye-jur-lica-h/). | | | If you do not have access to this page, you need to request for it. | |**Health and safety****What is EHS?**EHS stands for Environment, Health, and Safety. It is a multidisciplinary field that focuses on managing and ensuring the well-being of individuals and the protection of the environment within various settings, including workplaces, communities, and public spaces. EHS encompasses a wide range of practices, policies, and regulations that aim to prevent accidents, injuries, and illnesses while minimizing the negative impact on the environment. The primary objectives of EHS are to create safe and healthy working conditions, promote sustainable practices, and comply with legal requirements to safeguard both employees and the surrounding environment. By integrating these three essential components -- Environment, Health, and Safety -- organizations can proactively identify and mitigate potential hazards, reduce risks, and enhance overall performance. Key aspects of EHS include: 1. Environment: This aspect addresses the impact of human activities on the natural world. It involves assessing and managing issues such as air and water quality, waste management, energy efficiency, and the conservation of natural resources. By implementing environmentally responsible practices, organizations can contribute to a greener and more sustainable future. 2. Health: EHS aims to protect the health and well-being of individuals, whether they are employees, customers, or residents of nearby communities. This involves identifying workplace hazards, promoting healthy behaviors, providing proper training, and offering access to medical services to prevent and address illnesses and injuries. 3. Safety: Safety is a fundamental aspect of EHS, focusing on preventing accidents and injuries in various settings. Workplace safety measures can include ergonomic assessments, machine guarding, safety training, and emergency preparedness to ensure the physical well-being of employees and visitors. Adopting a robust EHS program not only helps organizations maintain a positive reputation but also enhances productivity and efficiency by reducing downtime due to accidents or environmental incidents. Additionally, it demonstrates a commitment to social responsibility and sustainability, which is increasingly important in today's world. Overall, EHS plays a vital role in maintaining a healthy workforce, protecting the environment, and contributing to the long-term success and resilience of businesses and communities alike.**Courses**[**Course health safety at work in English**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HESAWORK19) [**Course health safety at work in Georgian**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_GE) [**Course health safety at work in Armenian**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_HY) [**Course health safety at work in Spanish**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_ES) [**Course health safety at work in Azerbaijani**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_AZ) [**Course health safety at work in Turkish**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_TR) [**Course health safety at work in French**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_FR) [**Course health safety at work in Arabian**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_AR) [**Covid-19 info course**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/010203)**Risk reduction**Assessment of professional risks Identification of hazards: identify potential hazards in the office, including ergonomic issues, electrical malfunctions, and chemical exposures (detecting all risks related to equipment, environment, or processes). Risk Evaluation: analyzing the likelihood and severity of harm from each hazard - use checklists, inspections, and incident reports to assess risks (Tickets system in Yango). Risk reduction measures: developing strategies to minimize risks, such as safety protocols, training, and protective measures as well as implement engineering controls, administrative policies, and personal protective equipment to mitigate identified risks. Risks hunting Reporting safety concerns is crucial for maintaining a secure workplace. Employees can promptly identify and report hazards through the HSE reporting form: [  HSE risks hunting (en)](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/ext/surveys/13704655/) This proactive approach helps the HSE team investigate and implement corrective actions, preventing future incidents. Open communication fosters a culture of safety and ensures timely resolution of issues, protecting everyone in the workplace. Near Miss Near miss is an unplanned event that didn't result in injury, illness or damage -- but had the potential to do so. Hazard communication Hazard communication ensures that employees are informed about potential risks in the workplace. Open communication channels allow employees to report and address hazards promptly. By promoting transparency and awareness, hazard communication helps prevent accidents and fosters a safer work environment where everyone understands and complies with safety protocols. Information about risks Employees receive timely information about risks through: - Security guides - Meetings and trainings - Information materials in public places - Wiki pages - Safety signs - Briefings - Documents, tickets and feedback - Registers with employee signatures - Feedback channels Yango has internally established protocols for quickly informing employees about risks and dangers. In addition, in each country we organize internal emergency services from volunteers for timely monitoring and management of emergency situations, evacuations and first aid. Please report near miss directly via hse@yango.com**Contacts**If you have any questions, concerns, or suggestions regarding health, safety, or environmental issues, please don't hesitate to reach out to the HSE team.**[Вера Коншина](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/verakonshina) - Head of HSE department**\**[Мария Валиева](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/valievamv) - HSE specialist**We are here to support you, address your concerns, and help ensure a safe and healthy working environment for everyone. Your feedback and observations are invaluable in maintaining a culture of safety and continuous improvement. Let's work together to keep our workplace safe!\ \**Ergonomics\**The goal of our Ergonomics Program is to improve system and task design so that safety, health, comfort, and performance is maintained. Many factors play a role in ergonomics. These include body posture and movement (e.g., sitting, standing, lifting, pulling, and pushing), environmental factors (e.g., noise, vibration, illumination, climate) and processing of information (i.e., gained visually or through other senses). Risk factors include: - Sustained or awkward body postures - Excessive repetitive motions - Excessive or sustained force - Mechanical or contact stress - Muscle tension**Prevention is key. Here are some suggestions and tools to help you avoid ergonomic issues:**- [Ergonomic Guidelines for Setting up Your Computer Workstation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F8_ME4VwTiw) - [Office Ergonomics: Simple solutions for comfort and safety](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ofnpBtO1-gA) - [Ergonomics wrist](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OTSuhjpSLHg) - [Ergonomics Shoulder](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1vNbBCGgfe8) - [Ergonomics Neck](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fa4SFs85too) Remember to report any symptoms such as soreness, stiffness, burning, aching, numbness or weakness to your manager or to the EHS department. If you are uncomfortable for any reason, ask for help. [**Incidents report form**](mailto:https://forms.yandex.ru/surveys/13474814.6455b313d6c34f7e642dcf247db63a4b44502ed2/) -----------------------------------------------------------------------**Travel**----------------------------------------------------------------------- Here is the information related to business trips process for employees in Chile. Get to know how to organize your business trip, to receive daily allowance and how to reimburse business expenses. ----------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------**If you have questions regarding business trips and you [**Ask a have not found an answer on this page, please reach out Question**](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot) to a support team**--------------------------------------------------------- -- ----------------------------------------------------------------------- --- ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | Per each day of business trip, you are | | | | eligible to receive per diem (daily | | --------------------- | | allowance) after provision of receipts | | | | through business expenses reimbursement | |**Get to know | | ticket within daily limit for country of | | how to | | destination. | ---------------------------+---+ |  |  |**Health and Safety****What is EHS?**EHS stands for Environment, Health, and Safety. It is a
multidisciplinary field that focuses on managing and ensuring the well-being of individuals and the protection of the environment within
various settings, including workplaces, communities, and public spaces. EHS encompasses a wide range of practices, policies, and regulations
that aim to prevent accidents, injuries, and illnesses while minimizing the negative impact on the environment.

The primary objectives of EHS are to create safe and healthy working conditions, promote sustainable practices, and comply with legal
requirements to safeguard both employees and the surrounding environment. By integrating these three essential components --
Environment, Health, and Safety -- organizations can proactively identify and mitigate potential hazards, reduce risks, and enhance
overall performance.

Key aspects of EHS include:
1. Environment: This aspect addresses the impact of human activities on
    the natural world. It involves assessing and managing issues such as air and water quality, waste management, energy efficiency, and the
    conservation of natural resources. By implementing environmentally responsible practices, organizations can contribute to a greener and
    more sustainable future.
2. Health: EHS aims to protect the health and well-being of
    individuals, whether they are employees, customers, or residents of nearby communities. This involves identifying workplace hazards,
    promoting healthy behaviors, providing proper training, and offering access to medical services to prevent and address illnesses and
    injuries.
3. Safety: Safety is a fundamental aspect of EHS, focusing on
    preventing accidents and injuries in various settings. Workplace safety measures can include ergonomic assessments, machine guarding,
    safety training, and emergency preparedness to ensure the physical well-being of employees and visitors.

Adopting a robust EHS program not only helps organizations maintain a positive reputation but also enhances productivity and efficiency by
reducing downtime due to accidents or environmental incidents. Additionally, it demonstrates a commitment to social responsibility and
sustainability, which is increasingly important in today's world.

Overall, EHS plays a vital role in maintaining a healthy workforce, protecting the environment, and contributing to the long-term success
and resilience of businesses and communities alike.**Courses**[**Course health safety at work in English**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HESAWORK19)

[**Course health safety at work in Georgian**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_GE)

[**Course health safety at work in Armenian**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_HY)

[**Covid-19 info course**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/010203)**Risk reduction**Assessment of professional risks

Identification of hazards: identify potential hazards in the office, including ergonomic issues, electrical malfunctions, and chemical
exposures (detecting all risks related to equipment, environment, or processes).

Risk Evaluation: analyzing the likelihood and severity of harm from each hazard - use checklists, inspections, and incident reports to assess
risks (Tickets system in Yango).

Risk reduction measures: developing strategies to minimize risks, such as safety protocols, training, and protective measures as well as
implement engineering controls, administrative policies, and personal protective equipment to mitigate identified risks.

Risks hunting

Reporting safety concerns is crucial for maintaining a secure workplace. Employees can promptly identify and report hazards through the HSE
reporting form:

[  HSE risks hunting (en)](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/ext/surveys/13704655/)

This proactive approach helps the HSE team investigate and implement corrective actions, preventing future incidents. Open communication
fosters a culture of safety and ensures timely resolution of issues, protecting everyone in the workplace.

Near Miss

Near miss is an unplanned event that didn't result in injury, illness or damage -- but had the potential to do so.

Hazard communication

Hazard communication ensures that employees are informed about potential risks in the workplace. Open communication channels allow employees to
report and address hazards promptly.

By promoting transparency and awareness, hazard communication helps prevent accidents and fosters a safer work environment where everyone
understands and complies with safety protocols.

Information about risks

Employees receive timely information about risks through:
- Security guides
- Meetings and trainings
- Information materials in public places
- Wiki pages
- Safety signs
- Briefings
- Documents, tickets and feedback
- Registers with employee signatures
- Feedback channels

Yango has internally established protocols for quickly informing employees about risks and dangers. In addition, in each country we
organize internal emergency services from volunteers for timely monitoring and management of emergency situations, evacuations and first
aid.

Please report near miss directly via hse@yango.com**Contacts**If you have any questions, concerns, or suggestions regarding health, safety, or environmental issues, please don't hesitate to reach out to
the HSE team.**[Вера Коншина](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/verakonshina) - Head of HSE department**\**[Мария Валиева](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/valievamv) - HSE
specialist**We are here to support you, address your concerns, and help ensure a safe and healthy working environment for everyone.

Your feedback and observations are invaluable in maintaining a culture of safety and continuous improvement. Let's work together to keep our
workplace safe!\ \**Ergonomics\**The goal of our Ergonomics Program is to improve system and task
design so that safety, health, comfort, and performance is maintained. Many factors play a role in ergonomics. These include body posture and
movement (e.g., sitting, standing, lifting, pulling, and pushing), environmental factors (e.g., noise, vibration, illumination, climate)
and processing of information (i.e., gained visually or through other senses).

Risk factors include:
- Sustained or awkward body postures
- Excessive repetitive motions
- Excessive or sustained force
- Mechanical or contact stress
- Muscle tension**Prevention is key. Here are some suggestions and tools to help you
avoid ergonomic issues:**- [Ergonomic Guidelines for Setting up Your Computer Workstation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F8_ME4VwTiw)
- [Office Ergonomics: Simple solutions for comfort and
  safety](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ofnpBtO1-gA)
- [Ergonomics wrist](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OTSuhjpSLHg)
- [Ergonomics Shoulder](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1vNbBCGgfe8)
- [Ergonomics Neck](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fa4SFs85too)

Remember to report any symptoms such as soreness, stiffness, burning, aching, numbness or weakness to your manager or to the EHS department.
If you are uncomfortable for any reason, ask for help.

(Salud), | | | | | | | "Prevision", "Impuesto | | | Salary payment is once a | | | | | Único" and "Seguro | | | | | | | Cesantia". The amounts will | | | month, it is paid at the | | | | | be deducted from your salary | | | | | | | at the end of each month. | | | last business day, and | | | | +==============================+ | | | | | +------------------------------+ | | sometimes can be paid a | | | | | | | | | | | couple of days earlier. | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | At the day of payment you | | | | | | | | | | | will receive a payslip | | | | | | | | | | | with a payment breakdown. | | | | | | | | | | | If you have any doubts | | | | | | | | | | | about received amounts you | | | | | | | | | | | can always raise your | | | | | | | | | | | question | | | | | | | | | | | via [Helpy](https: | | | | | | | | | | | //h.yandex-team.ru/?https: | | | | | | | | | | | //t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot). | | | | | | += | | | | ===========================+===+ | | | | +- | | | | ---------------------------+---+ | | | |**Reimbursement**| | | --- | --- | | | | | Your expenses may be reimbursed if they are related to business | | | needs. When expense is approved by your manager, it is passed to the | | | accountant who makes such payment in regular days, but not on the | | | salary day. | | | | | | To know how to reimburse | | | click [here](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/finances/bus | | | iness-expenses/kak-otchitatsja-po-rasxodam-inostrannye-jur-lica-h/). | | | If you do not have access to this page, you need to request for it. | |**Health and safety****What is EHS?**EHS stands for Environment, Health, and Safety. It is a multidisciplinary field that focuses on managing and ensuring the well-being of individuals and the protection of the environment within various settings, including workplaces, communities, and public spaces. EHS encompasses a wide range of practices, policies, and regulations that aim to prevent accidents, injuries, and illnesses while minimizing the negative impact on the environment. The primary objectives of EHS are to create safe and healthy working conditions, promote sustainable practices, and comply with legal requirements to safeguard both employees and the surrounding environment. By integrating these three essential components -- Environment, Health, and Safety -- organizations can proactively identify and mitigate potential hazards, reduce risks, and enhance overall performance. Key aspects of EHS include: 1. Environment: This aspect addresses the impact of human activities on the natural world. It involves assessing and managing issues such as air and water quality, waste management, energy efficiency, and the conservation of natural resources. By implementing environmentally responsible practices, organizations can contribute to a greener and more sustainable future. 2. Health: EHS aims to protect the health and well-being of individuals, whether they are employees, customers, or residents of nearby communities. This involves identifying workplace hazards, promoting healthy behaviors, providing proper training, and offering access to medical services to prevent and address illnesses and injuries. 3. Safety: Safety is a fundamental aspect of EHS, focusing on preventing accidents and injuries in various settings. Workplace safety measures can include ergonomic assessments, machine guarding, safety training, and emergency preparedness to ensure the physical well-being of employees and visitors. Adopting a robust EHS program not only helps organizations maintain a positive reputation but also enhances productivity and efficiency by reducing downtime due to accidents or environmental incidents. Additionally, it demonstrates a commitment to social responsibility and sustainability, which is increasingly important in today's world. Overall, EHS plays a vital role in maintaining a healthy workforce, protecting the environment, and contributing to the long-term success and resilience of businesses and communities alike.**Courses**[**Course health safety at work in English**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HESAWORK19) [**Course health safety at work in Georgian**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_GE) [**Course health safety at work in Armenian**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_HY) [**Course health safety at work in Spanish**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_ES) [**Course health safety at work in Azerbaijani**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_AZ) [**Course health safety at work in Turkish**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_TR) [**Course health safety at work in French**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_FR) [**Course health safety at work in Arabian**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/HSEWORK19_AR) [**Covid-19 info course**](https://quantum.yandex-team.ru/courses/010203)**Risk reduction**Assessment of professional risks Identification of hazards: identify potential hazards in the office, including ergonomic issues, electrical malfunctions, and chemical exposures (detecting all risks related to equipment, environment, or processes). Risk Evaluation: analyzing the likelihood and severity of harm from each hazard - use checklists, inspections, and incident reports to assess risks (Tickets system in Yango). Risk reduction measures: developing strategies to minimize risks, such as safety protocols, training, and protective measures as well as implement engineering controls, administrative policies, and personal protective equipment to mitigate identified risks. Risks hunting Reporting safety concerns is crucial for maintaining a secure workplace. Employees can promptly identify and report hazards through the HSE reporting form: [  HSE risks hunting (en)](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/ext/surveys/13704655/) This proactive approach helps the HSE team investigate and implement corrective actions, preventing future incidents. Open communication fosters a culture of safety and ensures timely resolution of issues, protecting everyone in the workplace. Near Miss Near miss is an unplanned event that didn't result in injury, illness or damage -- but had the potential to do so. Hazard communication Hazard communication ensures that employees are informed about potential risks in the workplace. Open communication channels allow employees to report and address hazards promptly. By promoting transparency and awareness, hazard communication helps prevent accidents and fosters a safer work environment where everyone understands and complies with safety protocols. Information about risks Employees receive timely information about risks through: - Security guides - Meetings and trainings - Information materials in public places - Wiki pages - Safety signs - Briefings - Documents, tickets and feedback - Registers with employee signatures - Feedback channels Yango has internally established protocols for quickly informing employees about risks and dangers. In addition, in each country we organize internal emergency services from volunteers for timely monitoring and management of emergency situations, evacuations and first aid. Please report near miss directly via hse@yango.com**Contacts**If you have any questions, concerns, or suggestions regarding health, safety, or environmental issues, please don't hesitate to reach out to the HSE team.**[Вера Коншина](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/verakonshina) - Head of HSE department**\**[Мария Валиева](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/valievamv) - HSE specialist**We are here to support you, address your concerns, and help ensure a safe and healthy working environment for everyone. Your feedback and observations are invaluable in maintaining a culture of safety and continuous improvement. Let's work together to keep our workplace safe!\ \**Ergonomics\**The goal of our Ergonomics Program is to improve system and task design so that safety, health, comfort, and performance is maintained. Many factors play a role in ergonomics. These include body posture and movement (e.g., sitting, standing, lifting, pulling, and pushing), environmental factors (e.g., noise, vibration, illumination, climate) and processing of information (i.e., gained visually or through other senses). Risk factors include: - Sustained or awkward body postures - Excessive repetitive motions - Excessive or sustained force - Mechanical or contact stress - Muscle tension**Prevention is key. Here are some suggestions and tools to help you avoid ergonomic issues:**- [Ergonomic Guidelines for Setting up Your Computer Workstation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F8_ME4VwTiw) - [Office Ergonomics: Simple solutions for comfort and safety](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ofnpBtO1-gA) - [Ergonomics wrist](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OTSuhjpSLHg) - [Ergonomics Shoulder](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1vNbBCGgfe8) - [Ergonomics Neck](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fa4SFs85too) Remember to report any symptoms such as soreness, stiffness, burning, aching, numbness or weakness to your manager or to the EHS department. If you are uncomfortable for any reason, ask for help. [**Incidents report form**](mailto:https://forms.yandex.ru/surveys/13474814.6455b313d6c34f7e642dcf247db63a4b44502ed2/) -----------------------------------------------------------------------**Travel**----------------------------------------------------------------------- Here is the information related to business trips process for employees in Chile. Get to know how to organize your business trip, to receive daily allowance and how to reimburse business expenses. ----------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------**If you have questions regarding business trips and you [**Ask a have not found an answer on this page, please reach out Question**](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot) to a support team**--------------------------------------------------------- -- ----------------------------------------------------------------------- --- ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | Per each day of business trip, you are | | | | eligible to receive per diem (daily | | --------------------- | | allowance) after provision of receipts | | | | through business expenses reimbursement | |**Get to know | | ticket within daily limit for country of | | how to | | destination. # Region: LatAm, Country: Peru

This document provides comprehensive information for Yango employees in Peru, including general facts, time off policies, travel procedures, payroll information, benefits, and committee structures.

toolUseResult.originalFileContents:
---
region: LatAm topic: Peru
---

topic: Peru
-**Peru**Pay date**Last business day of each month**Currency**Peruvian Soles (PEN)**Official language**Spanish**Offices**[Delivery Technologies
S.A.C**](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://maps.app.goo.gl/LWtKACBhK3zctC6W8)

Public Holidays & Vacation**[16 days](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/hr/calendar/kalendar-na-2024-eng/)**of
public holidays**30 calendar days**of annual leave

Employee taxes**Income tax:**up to 30% depending\ on the annual remuneration**Pension fund:**10-13% depending on a chosen\
pension system

  -----------------------------------------------------------------------**Time off**-----------------------------------------------------------------------

  -----------------------------------------------------------------------

different kind of leaves in Peru

How to organize your time off

1 Talk to your manager to discuss the dates of planning time off

2 Specify your time off at the Absence Planner on Staff. For vacation set it no less than 2 weeks before it starts

3 There will be a ticket automatically generated (VACATION / SICKLEAVE)

4 Your manager must confirm your planned time off in the ticket or at the Absence Planner

5 A few days before your planned time off starts, HR admin will contact you via the ticket to attach necessary documents, if needed

6 Time off will be considered in payroll of the month in which it is taken. Please make sure you provided all requested documentation**General leaves****Annual leave**Each employee is entitled to 30 calendar days of annual leave, public
holidays are not included. You can enjoy your vacation in an uninterrupted 30 days manner. However, the vacation period can be split
in the following way:
- 15 calendar days, which should be used in periods of 7 and 8 days in a
  row;
- the rest of the vacation period can be divided into different periods
  with a minimum of 1 calendar day.

Vacation for the previous period should be used during the current year, it shouldn't be transferred and must be paid out in cash if it is not
used.**Unpaid leave**On exceptional cases there is an option for you to take unpaid vacation.

This leave is granted only if there is a valid reason, which you must specify in the application form (you can specify briefly «for personal
reasons» or «for family reasons»). The duration of such leave is a point of discussion between you and your manager.

  ------------------------------------------------------------------------
            Unpaid leave exceptional cases is at the discretion of the company.
  ------ -- --------------------------------------------------------------

  ------------------------------------------------------------------------**Sick leave**It is necessary for you to submit to the employer a certificate
certifying that this leave was granted by the authorized physician.

Medical confirmation is required in order that those absences are not considered unjustified absences.

Sickness is paid only if you provide a medical certificate (sick list) issued by a by the authorized physician.**Leave for the assistance of family members\
in a delicate state of health**This is a leave of absence with the purpose that you can assist your direct family members or those diagnosed in a serious or terminal
condition or suffer an accident that puts their life at serious risk.

This leave only applies for the care and assistance of your direct relatives: parents, children, spouse or partner.

7 continuous calendar days are granted on account of vacation.

  ------------------------------------------------------------------------
            Уou should provide us the application form, fully signed by the authorized physician.
  ------ -- --------------------------------------------------------------

  ------------------------------------------------------------------------**Childcare**If this is a current case and you need to take one of these types of
leave, please raise a ticket via Helpy and HR admin will help you to organize childcare leaves.**Maternity leave**A mother has 98 calendar days of rest due to maternity leave, which can
be distributed in two stages:
- 49 days of pre-natal rest;
- 49 days of post-natal rest.

The rest may be extended by 30 additional days in case of multiple births or birth of children with disabilities.**Paternity leave**Paternity leave is granted to fathers to attend the birth of their
child.

It is granted 10 days of paid leave, it cannot be waived or substituted. The period may be extended up to 30 additional days in special cases.**Adoption leave**You will have a leave of thirty calendar days for the adoption process
of a minor for the strengthening of the paternal-filial bond.**Breastfeeding leave**A mother has a leave of one hour per day within the working day, which is counted as one hour worked, for breastfeeding purpose.

This is the mandatory benefit, and a mother cannot cease from this benefit, nor compensate or substitute it.

#### Who is my manager?

Your manager according to organizational chart is shown as Head on your [Staff](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/).

#### How can I get access to Absence Planner?

Please contact your manager. Your manager is responsible to grant you access to the [Absence Planner](http://gap.yandex-team.ru/).

#### I was sick, but I do not have a medical certificate.

Medical confirmation is required in order that those absences are not considered unjustified absences. Please contact your manager to discuss
your absence and the better way to fill this absence.

#### What happens if my manager did not approve vacation?

This absence will be considered as unjustified absences. Please make sure that your manager properly confirmed your days of rest.

#### Where can I check an available number of days for annual leave?

Approximate number is shown on your Staff page.**Note**Уour vacation balance on Staff is updated on the first week of each month and it is relevant as of the last day of the previous month. Also,
on Staff you will see only integral numbers. It means that sometimes you will see a lower number of available vacation days then it is in fact.

#### Can I change or cancel the vacation, if it was already confirmed?

You can both change and cancel your approved vacation.

You will need to update the dates of your vacation at Absence planner and follow the process «How to» starting from the step № 4. To cancel
you vacation please use the Absence planner as well.

##**Travel**If you have questions regarding business trips and you have not found an
answer on this page, please reach out to a support team <https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot>

Per each day of business trip, you are eligible to receive per diem (daily allowance). The daily rate depends on a country you travel to,
and the daily amount covers two visits to medium-priced restaurants and two taxi rides.

Per diems will be paid in the nearest salary payment after your business trip finishes. The payment will be in PEN with the exchange rate as of
approximately 20th of the month of payment.

Daily allowance is not taxable due to Peruvian law, hence you do not have to pay income tax from them. Also, you do not have to provide us
with proofs of expenses of daily allowance amounts since it is not required by Peruvian legislation.

#### [Get to know how to organize a business trip and check appropriate daily allowance rate](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/hr/travel-all/)

To organize your business trip you may use [Business Trips](http://trip.yandex-team.ru/). The platform allows you to make
searching, booking and approving travel tickets and hotels. You can use the option to select your preferred currency (rubles, dollars, or euros)
to manage your travel budget better. If you have any questions about the platform, feel free to reach out
to [\@HelpyTravelBot](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/HelpyTravelBot).

Also you can find more information [here](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/users/anngolovina/oformlenie-komandirovok-mezhdunarodnyx-ofisov1/)
( Trip approval, Travel policy: tickets, hotels, Per diem, Change/cancel trip, make report)

How the business trip process is organized
1. Create a request

Decide on travel dates, itinerary, and other details beforehand
2. Wait for approval

Requests are normally approved by your manager or HRBP
3. Book travel and accommodation

Select your flights/train tickets and hotel
4. Woohoo, you're all set!

Read about taxis, connectivity, and other important travel considerations
5. There's a fair amount of bureaucracy

All you need to know about daily allowances and business trip reports

## General rules

Please plan and create business trips as far in advance as possible. Below are the recommended minimum terms for creating a ticket for a
business trip:\
- Domestic business trip within a country - 5-7 days.\
- Foreign business trip (visa not necessary) - 2,5-3 weeks\
- Foreign business trip (visa needed) - 5-6 weeks\
- US business trip (visa required) - 3-4 months (time frame depends on
availability of visa slots).

Follow this link to issue TRAVEL request <https://trip.yandex-team.ru/trips/new/>

# Payroll

If you have questions regarding payroll, please reach out to a support team <https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot>

#### Salary

Salary payment is once a month, it is paid at the last business day, and sometimes can be paid a couple of days earlier.

At the day of payment you will receive a payslip with a payment breakdown. If you have any doubts about received amounts you can always
raise your question via [Helpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot).

| #### Taxes and contributions |
|  |
| Peruvian legislation has a progressive rate of income tax. The rate |
| is from 0 to 30% and depends on your annual income. The income tax is |
| deductible from your income. |
|  |
| Also, the Company will deduct from your salary contributions to APF |
| (Pension funds) and the % will depend on an AFP you chose, however, |
| normally it's around 12-13%. |
|  |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Tax-exempts: CTS, per diems, material help |
| ----- ------------------------------------------------------------ |
|  |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------ |
#### Reimbursement

Your expenses may be reimbursed if they are related to business needs. When expense is approved by your manager, it is passed to the accountant
who makes such payment in regular days, but not on the salary day.

To know how to reimburse click [here](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/finances/business-expenses/kak-otchitatsja-po-rasxodam-inostrannye-jur-lica-h/).
If you do not have access to this page, you need to request for it.

#### How can I update my bank details in systems?

Please fill out [this form](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/surveys/160874/) to change your bank
details.

#### How was my KPI bonus calculated?

The amount of your bonuses is given by your manager and approved by your HR BP, so that we would recommend you contact them accordingly. If you
still have doubts, please reach out to support team via [Helpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot).

#### Who is my manager?

Your manager according to organizational chart is shown as Head on your [Staff](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/).

#### Who is my HR BP?

Your HR BP is shown as HR-partner on your [Staff](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/).

|  | Please contact us in case of questions <int_benefits@yango.com> |  |
|  |  |  |
|  |**Offboarding**|  |
|  |  |  |
|  | To ensure a smooth transition before you leave, here are some |  |
|  | information related to offboarding process in Angola.\ |  |
|  | If you have questions regarding offboarding and you have not |  |
|  | found an answer on this page, please reach out to a support team |  |
|  | <https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot> |  |
|  |  |  |
|  |**1**Talk to |  |
|  | your [manage |  |
|  | r](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/employees/country-guides/angola/o |  |
|  | ffboarding/?from=%2Femployees%2Fangola%2Foffboarding#manager) to |  |
|  | confirm the date of resignation |  |
|  |  |  |
|  |**2**[Create a |  |
|  | ticket](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/surveys/137377/) and attach |  |
|  | your wet-signed [resignation |  |
|  | letter](https://jing.yandex-t |  |
|  | eam.ru/files/annaparchim/resignation%20letter%20template-1.docx) |  |
|  |  |  |
|  |**3**Provide wet-signed hard copy of the resignation letter to |  |
|  | HR at the office or ask a right |  |
|  | contact [ |  |
|  | Helpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot) |  |
|  |  |  |
|  |**4**Finalize pending expense reports |  |
|  |  |  |
|  |**5**Return company's assets at the last date |  |
|  |  |  |
|  |**6**Receive final payment and all necessary certificates |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | ## Key Points |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### Payment |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Your final payment will be paid with the nearest payroll after |  |
|  | your date of resignation. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | We will pay your salary and all the benefits you are entitled, |  |
|  | accrued up until your last day. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### Health insurance |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | In case you are eligible Health Insurance Protection, it will |  |
|  | end at the last day of the month of resignation. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Please reach out |  |
|  | to [Helpy](htt |  |
|  | ps://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot) regarding |  |
|  | to your insurance details, or to answer any of your questions. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Final documentation |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | After the resignation you will receive the final payslip by both |  |
|  | your personal and work email. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Would you need any additional documentation please raise your |  |
|  | request |  |
|  | via [H |  |
|  | elpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot). |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### Workman insurance |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Your life insurance protection will end at the last day of the |  |
|  | month of resignation. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Please reach out |  |
|  | to [Helpy](htt |  |
|  | ps://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot) regarding |  |
|  | to your insurance details, or to answer any of your questions. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | +-------------------------------------------------------+----+ |  |
|  |  | #### Resignation ticket |  |  |  |
|  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  |  | To create a ticket for your resignation fill in [the |  |  |  |
|  |  | form](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/surveys/137377/). |  |  |  |
|  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  |  | Please specify the date of resignation in the form, |  |  |  |
|  |  | approved by your manager and attach your signed |  |  |  |
|  |  | resignation letter. |  |  |  |
|  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  |  | Please note that standard notice period for |  |  |  |
|  |  | resignation in Angola is 30 calendar days. |  |  |  |
|  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  |  | A blank for resignation letter you can find in |  |  |  |
|  |  | Documents. |  |  |  |
|  | +=======================================================+====+ |  |
|  | +-------------------------------------------------------+----+ |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### Expense reports |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | You must make sure you have submitted all outstanding expenses |  |
|  | before you leave. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Expense report instruction can be |  |
|  | found [here](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/finances/busines |  |
|  | s-expenses/kak-otchitatsja-po-rasxodam-inostrannye-jur-lica-h/). |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | We highly recommend you submitting expense reports in advance. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### How can I create a ticket to apply for resignation? |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Please fill in [the |  |
|  | form](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/surveys/137377/) and attach |  |
|  | your resignation letter. The ticket will be automatically |  |
|  | generated, HR Admin will contact you via the ticket if any |  |
|  | additional information is needed. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### Who is my manager? |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Your manager according to organizational chart is shown as Head |  |
|  | on your [Staff](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/). |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### Is this possible to receive a reference letter? |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | If you need a reference letter, please contact support |  |
|  | via [H |  |
|  | elpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot). |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### Can I receive a Job certificate in English? |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | English language is a standard for Job certificate. However, if |  |
|  | you would like to have an addition Job certificate on |  |
|  | Portuguese, please contact support |  |
|  | via [He |  |
|  | lpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot) a |  |
|  | few days in advance of your resignation date. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### How can I contact HR after the termination date? |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Please send an email with your question |  |
|  | on <helpy@yandex-team.ru> |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### Can I buy company's equipment? |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | There are some rules. More information |  |
|  | is [here](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/pokupka/dismissal/). |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### Can I get the work certificate? |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Yes, you will get the work certificate not later than your last |  |
|  | working day. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | # Сommittees |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | +-------------------------------------------------------------+ |  |
|  |  | > Here is the information about established Committees in |  |  |
|  |  | > Peru. |  |  |
|  | +=============================================================+ |  |
|  | +-------------------------------------------------------------+ |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### Health and Safety Committee |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Validity period: August 1st, 2024 -- July 31st, 2026. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | The main goal of the HSE committee is to coordinate the efforts |  |
|  | of employers and employees to create a safe working environment |  |
|  | and prevent work-related injuries and illnesses. This includes |  |
|  | developing and implementing programs to improve work conditions, |  |
|  | monitoring work conditions in the workplace, conducting regular |  |
|  | inspections of work sites, participating in special assessments |  |
|  | of working conditions, conducting risk assessments, and |  |
|  | investigating incidents and near-miss events. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Members of the committee: |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | - The President of the Committee - [Carlos Davis Herrera |  |
|  | Cruz](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/cherrerac) |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | - The Secretary of the Committee - [Sandra Jeannette Galiano |  |
|  | Rivera](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/sandragaliano) |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Representative of the Employees: |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | - [Tamayo Izquierdo |  |
|  | Mylene](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/mylenetamayo) |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | - [Godoy Altamirano Maria |  |
|  | Claudia](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/maclagodoy) |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | #### Committee for the Intervention against Sexual Harassment |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Validity period: November 8th, 2024 -- November 7th, 2026. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | This Committee is the body responsible for receiving reports or |  |
|  | complaints of sexual harassment, preparing the pre-qualification |  |
|  | report, and granting protection measures in cases of sexual |  |
|  | harassment, acting in coordination with the Complaints |  |
|  | Investigation team established in HQ. |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Members of the committee: |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | - The President of the Committee - [Carlos Davis Herrera |  |
|  | Cruz](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/cherrerac) |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | - [Sandra Jeannette Galiano |  |
|  | Rivera](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/sandragaliano) |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | Representative of the Employees: |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | - The Secretary of the Committee - [Diana |  |
|  | Gutierrez](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/dgutierrez) |  |
|  |  |  |
|  | - [Edison Gutierrez](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/edisong) |  |
| +==================================================================+ |

| +============+===+ |  |  |  |  |
| +------------+---+ |  |  |  |  |**Salary**Salary payment is once a month, it is paid at the last business day, and
sometimes can be paid a couple of days earlier.

Within 4 working days after the payment you will receive a payslip with a payment breakdown. If you have any doubts about received amounts you
can always raise your question via Helpy.**Taxes and contributions**The Company will deduct from your salary contributions to AFP (Pension funds) with 12.71 % of your salary.

The rate of payments to National Solidarity Fund are 1.15%, 5.74% and
11.48%, and the deduction depends on your salary.

The rate of Income tax (RC-IVA) is 13% of the total salary and the deduction depends on your salary. Also, this tax can be compensated with
the purchase invoices from you.

Completed form 110 and the invoices must be declared to the SIAT webpage HR team until 10th of each month, however, the sooner the better.

Reimbursement

Your expenses may be reimbursed if they are related to business needs. When expense is approved by your manager, it is passed to the accountant
who makes such payment in regular days, but not on the salary day.

To know how to reimburse click here. If you do not have access to this page, you need to request for it.

I need to add headers to all markdown files in the data/MENAP directory and its subdirectories. Each header should follow the pattern "# Region: MENAP, Country: [CountryName]" for country-specific files, or "# Region: MENAP, Country: [CountryName], Topic: [TopicName]" for topic-specific files within countries.

Please:
1. Find all .md files in data/MENAP/ and subdirectories
2. Read the first few lines of each file to understand the current header format
3. Replace the existing header (usually "---\nregion: MENAP...\n---\n\ntopic: ...") with a proper markdown header
4. For files in country subdirectories like Morocco, Oman, Pakistan, UAE, include the country name
5. For office-specific files in UAE (like INTERNET CITY and ONE CENTRAL subdirectories), use "# Region: MENAP, Country: UAE, Office: [OfficeName], Topic: [TopicName]"
6. For topic-specific files, include both country and topic
7. Add a brief description under the header explaining what the document contains

Make sure to handle all the files systematically and return a summary of what was processed.

# Region: MENAP, Country: Morocco, Topic: Health Safety and Environmental

This document outlines the Environment, Health, and Safety (EHS) policies and procedures for employees in Morocco.

toolUseResult.originalFileContents:
---
region: MENAP country: Morocco
topic: Health Safety And Environmental
---

country: Morocco topic: Health Safety And Environmental
-**What is EHS?**EHS stands for Environment, Health, and Safety. It is a
multidisciplinary field that focuses on managing and ensuring the well-being of individuals and the protection of the environment within
various settings, including workplaces, communities, and public spaces. EHS encompasses a wide range of practices, policies, and regulations
that aim to prevent accidents, injuries, and illnesses while minimizing the negative impact on the environment.

The primary objectives of EHS are to create safe and healthy working conditions, promote sustainable practices, and comply with legal
requirements to safeguard both employees and the surrounding environment. By integrating these three essential components --
Environment, Health, and Safety -- organizations can proactively identify and mitigate potential hazards, reduce risks, and enhance
overall performance.**Key aspects of EHS include:**1. Environment: This aspect addresses the impact of human activities on the natural world. It involves assessing and managing issues such as
    air and water quality, waste management, energy efficiency, and the conservation of natural resources. By implementing environmentally
    responsible practices, organizations can contribute to a greener and more sustainable future.
2. Health: EHS aims to protect the health and well-being of
    individuals, whether they are employees, customers, or residents of nearby communities. This involves identifying workplace hazards,
    promoting healthy behaviors, providing proper training, and offering access to medical services to prevent and address illnesses and
    injuries.
3. Safety: Safety is a fundamental aspect of EHS, focusing on
    preventing accidents and injuries in various settings. Workplace safety measures can include ergonomic assessments, machine guarding,
    safety training, and emergency preparedness to ensure the physical well-being of employees and visitors.

Adopting a robust EHS program not only helps organizations maintain a positive reputation but also enhances productivity and efficiency by
reducing downtime due to accidents or environmental incidents. Additionally, it demonstrates a commitment to social responsibility and
sustainability, which is increasingly important in today's world.

Overall, EHS plays a vital role in maintaining a healthy workforce, protecting the environment, and contributing to the long-term success
and resilience of businesses and communities alike.**Risk Reduction****Assessment of professional risks****Identification of hazards:**identify potential hazards in the office, including ergonomic issues, electrical malfunctions, and chemical
exposures (detecting all risks related to equipment, environment, or processes).**Risk Evaluation:**analyzing the likelihood and severity of harm from
each hazard - use checklists, inspections, and incident reports to assess risks (Tickets system in Yango).**Risk reduction measures:**developing strategies to minimize risks,
such as safety protocols, training, and protective measures as well as implement engineering controls, administrative policies, and personal
protective equipment to mitigate identified risks.**Risks hunting**Reporting safety concerns is crucial for maintaining a secure workplace. Employees can promptly identify and report hazards through the HSE
reporting form: [HSE risks hunting (en)](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/ext/surveys/13704655/).

This proactive approach helps the HSE team investigate and implement corrective actions, preventing future incidents. Open communication
fosters a culture of safety and ensures timely resolution of issues, protecting everyone in the workplace.**Near Miss**Near miss is an unplanned event that didn't result in injury, illness or
damage -- but had the potential to do so.**Hazard communication**Hazard communication ensures that employees are informed about potential risks in the workplace. Open communication channels allow employees to
report and address hazards promptly.

By promoting transparency and awareness, hazard communication helps prevent accidents and fosters a safer work environment where everyone
understands and complies with safety protocols.**Information about risks**Employees receive timely information about risks through:
- Security guides
- Meetings and trainings
- Information materials in public places
- Wiki pages
- Safety signs
- Briefings
- Documents, tickets and feedback
- Registers with employee signatures
- Feedback channels

Yango has internally established protocols for quickly informing employees about risks and dangers. In addition, in each country we
organize internal emergency services from volunteers for timely monitoring and management of emergency situations, evacuations and first
aid.

Please report near miss directly via hse@yango.com**Ergonomics**The goal of our Ergonomics Program is to improve system and task design so that safety, health, comfort, and performance is maintained. Many
factors play a role in ergonomics. These include body posture and movement (e.g., sitting, standing, lifting, pulling, and pushing),
environmental factors (e.g., noise, vibration, illumination, climate) and processing of information (i.e., gained visually or through other
senses).**Risk factors include:**- Sustained or awkward body postures
- Excessive repetitive motions
- Excessive or sustained force
- Mechanical or contact stress
- Muscle tension**Prevention is key. Here are some suggestions and tools to help you
avoid ergonomic issues:**- [Ergonomic Guidelines for Setting up Your Computer Workstation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F8_ME4VwTiw)
- [Office Ergonomics: Simple solutions for comfort and
  safety](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ofnpBtO1-gA)
- [Ergonomics wrist](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OTSuhjpSLHg)
- [Ergonomics Shoulder](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1vNbBCGgfe8)
- [Ergonomics Neck](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fa4SFs85too)

Remember to report any symptoms such as soreness, stiffness, burning, aching, numbness or weakness to your manager or to the EHS department.
If you are uncomfortable for any reason, ask for help.**HSE Team**If you have any questions, concerns, or suggestions regarding health, safety, or environmental issues, please don't hesitate to reach out to
the HSE team.

[Vera Konshina](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/verakonshina)**- Head of HSE department**\
[Mariia Valieva****](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/valievamv)**- HSE specialist**We are here to support you, address your concerns, and help ensure a
safe and healthy working environment for everyone.

Your feedback and observations are invaluable in maintaining a culture of safety and continuous improvement. Let's work together to keep our
workplace safe!

country: Morocco topic: Offboarding
- To ensure a smooth transition before you leave, here is some information
related to offboarding process.

Talk to your [manager](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/employees/country-guides/dubai/offboarding/?from=%2Femployees%2Fdubai%2Foffboarding#who-is-my-manager) to notify
about termination and agree on the termination date

[Create a ticket ](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/surveys/137377/)and attach your [resignation
letter](https://jing.yandex-team.ru/files/irina-tsekh/Resignation%20letter%20sample.docx), get it approved by your manager

Sign needed papers regarding termination and visa/work permit cancellation provided by HR Admin

Finalize pending expense reports

Return company's assets on the last day

Receive final payment**Key Points**Payment

Your final payment will be paid within 60 business days after your CTS will be authorized by Labour authorities.

We will pay your salary and all the benefits you are entitled, accrued up until your last day.

Life insurance

Your life insurance (Workplace accident insurance) will end at the last day of the month of resignation.

Please reach out to [Helpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot) regarding
to your insurance details, or to answer any of your questions.

#### Final documentation

During 8 days after the termination date (including the termination date), we will prepare for you Certificate de travail.

You can pick up your certificate at the office.

#### Resignation ticket

Please specify the date of resignation in the resignation letter (CTS form), approve it by your manager and authorize your CTS in Labour
Authorities. A blank for resignation letter you can find in Documents.

After that please fill out the [form](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/surveys/137377/) and attach your
signed resignation letter.

Please note that standard notice period for resignation in Morocco is from 1 month to 3 months depending on your seniority in the company.

#### Expense reports

You must make sure you have submitted all outstanding expenses before you leave.

Expense report instruction can be found [here](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/finances/business-expenses/kak-otchitatsja-po-rasxodam-inostrannye-jur-lica-h/).

We highly recommend you submitting expense reports in advance.

#### How can I create a ticket to apply for resignation?

Please fill the [form](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/surveys/137377/) and attach a screenshot of your resignation letter. The ticket will
be automatically generated, HR Admin will contact you via the ticket if any additional information is needed.

#### Is this possible to receive a reference letter?

If you need a reference letter, please contact support via [Helpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot).

#### How can I contact HR after the termination date?

Please send an email with your question on <helpy@yandex-team.ru>

- [OpenUp](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://openup.com/) is an online
platform with all sorts of resources to support the mental and emotional health of Yango employees and their families.

OpenUp service is free for Yango employees in Africa and Latin America and their family members. It is available to everyone starting from
their first day at Yango.

All information related to your participation in the OpenUp support program is strictly confidential. Yango doesn't receive any kind of
personal information from the provider. The psychologists are committed to the professional ethical code so any information shared with them is
kept confidential.**What is OpenUp**it helps you to solve a wide range of problems and challenges in your lives.
- Online 1:1 sessions with certified psychologists and
lifestyle-experts in over 25 languages
- Online masterclasses, mindfulness and group sessions access
- Self check-in
- Online programs, articles and courses

### How many sessions are available?

### --- 5 sessions per issue (unlimited number of issues per year) in your first language

country: Morocco topic: Payroll
-**Salary**Salary payment is once a month, it is paid at the last business day, and
sometimes can be paid a couple of days earlier.

Within 4 working days after the payment you will receive a payslip with a payment breakdown. If you have any doubts about received amounts you
can always raise your question via [Helpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot).**Taxes and contributions**Moroccan legislation has a progressive rate of income tax. The rate is
from 0 to 38% and depends on your annual income. The income tax is deductible from your income.

Also, the Company will deduct from your salary contributions to CNSS (National Security Fund) -- 4.48 % and Medical Coverage ​AMO -- 2.26 %.**Reimbursement**Your expenses may be reimbursed if they are related to business needs.
When expense is approved by your manager, it is passed to the accountant who makes such payment in regular days, but not on the salary day.

To know how to reimburse click [here](https://wiki.yandex-team.ru/finances/business-expenses/kak-otchitatsja-po-rasxodam-inostrannye-jur-lica-h/).
If you do not have access to this page, you need to request for it.**How can I update my bank details in systems?**Please fill out [this form](https://forms.yandex-team.ru/surveys/160874/) to change your bank
details.**How was my KPI bonus calculated?**The amount of your bonuses is given by your manager and approved by your HR BP, so that we would recommend you contact them accordingly. If you
still have doubts, please reach out to support team via [Helpy](https://h.yandex-team.ru/?https://t.me/YandexHelpDeskbot).

# Region: MENAP, Country: Morocco, Topic: Time Off

This document provides information about vacation planning, time off requests, and absence management for employees in Morocco.

toolUseResult.originalFileContents:
---
region: MENAP country: Morocco
topic: Time Off
---

country: Morocco topic: Time Off
-**How to**Talk to your manager to discuss the dates of planning time off

Specify your time off at the [Absence Planner](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/gap/) on Staff. For vacation set
it no less than 2 weeks before it starts

There will be a ticket automatically generated (VACATION / SICKLEAVE)

Your manager must confirm your planned time off in the ticket or at the [Absence Planner](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/gap/)

A few days before your planned time off starts, HR admin will contact you via the ticket to attach necessary documents, if needed

Time off will be considered in payroll of the month in which it is taken. Please make sure you provided all requested documentation.**General leaves****Annual leave**Each employee is entitled to minimum 18 business days of annual leave,
public holidays are not included. You can enjoy your vacation in an uninterrupted 18 days manner.​

The vacation period can be split or accumulated over a maximum period of 2 years.

The duration of the annual leave is increased by 1.5 days of actual work for each full period, continuous or not, of 5 years of service, however
this increase will not be bringing the total duration of the leave to more than 30 days of actual work.

No penalties if employee takes no vacations.**Unpaid leave**On exceptional cases there is an option for you to take unpaid vacation.

This leave is granted only if there is a valid reason, which you must specify in the application form (you can specify briefly «for personal
reasons» or «for family reasons»). The duration of such leave is a point of discussion between you and your manager.

  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
        Unpaid leave exceptional cases is at the discretion of the company.
  -- -- ---------------------------------------------------------------------

  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------**Sick leave**You must immediately notify your line manager, within 48 hours at the
latest, except in cases of force majeure.

Medical confirmation is required in order that those absences are not considered unjustified absences.

Sickness is paid only if you provide a medical certificate (sick list) issued by a by the authorized physician.**Other paid leaves**According to labour legislation of Morocco you have the right for paid
leaves for the following events:

Marriage -- 4 days for your own marriage; 2 days for the marriage of your children or children from a previous marriage of your spouse​

Bereavement -- 3 days for the death of the spouse, a child, a grandchild, an ascendant or a child from a previous marriage of your
spouse; ​2 days for the death of a brother or sister, a brother or sister of your spouse or an ascendant your spouse

Circumcision -- 2 days​

Surgery -- 2 days if surgery on a spouse or dependent child

You will need to provide information and all the necessary documents upon request of HR admin.**Childcare**If this is a current case and you need to take one of these types of
leave, please raise a ticket via Helpy and HR admin will help you to organize childcare leaves.**Maternity leave**A mother has 14 weeks of rest due to maternity leave, which can be
distributed in two stages:
- 7 weeks of pre-natal rest, and
- 7 weeks of post-natal rest.​

The rest may be extended in case of multiple births or birth of children with disabilities.**New born leave**An employee has the right, on the occasion of each birth, to a 3 days of
paid leave.

It can be taken no later than 1 month from the date of birth.

This provision applies in the event of recognition by the employee of the paternity of a child.**Breastfeeding leave**A mother has the right daily, to breastfeed her child, during working
hours, to a special rest, paid as working time, of half an hour in the morning and half an hour in the afternoon.

A mother can, in agreement with her manager, benefit from the time reserved for breastfeeding at any time during the working days.**How can I get access to Absence Planner?**Please contact your manager. Your manager is responsible to grant you
access to the [Absence Planner](https://staff.yandex-team.ru/gap/).**I was sick, but I don't have a medical certificate.**Medical confirmation is required in order that those absences are not considered unjustified absences. Please contact your manager to discuss
your absence and the better way to fill this absence.**What happens if my manager didn't approve my vacation?**This absence will be considered as unjustified absences. Please make sure that your manager properly confirmed your days of rest.**Where can I check an available number of days for annual leave?**Approximate number is shown on your Staff page.

Уour vacation balance on Staff is updated on the first week of each month and it is relevant as of the last day of the previous month. Also,
on Staff you will see only integral numbers. It means that sometimes you will see a lower number of available vacation days than it is in fact.**Can I change or cancel the vacation, if it was already confirmed?**You can both change and cancel your approved vacation.

You will need to update the dates of your vacation at Absence planner and follow the process «How to» starting from the step № 4.

To cancel you vacation please use the Absence planner as well.
